ResultConclusion: You share your conclusions with Varko who does not hide his concern. You reassure him by confirming that you intend to help his young friend.

Name: Reflections on the Blade
Content: Looking through the window, you catch a glimpse of what looks to be a magical figure of a swordsman in training.
ResultConclusion: You might never know who that former fencing master was, but replicating his moves has imparted you with valuable knowledge on the techniques of the sword.

Name: Yield Evaluation
Content:
You come across a miner who has convinced himself that there is a mineral deposit of great value in the swamp. 

Having walked through the swamp and only seen moss-covered boulders, you're highly doubtful of this theory. Convincing him to drop the idea would save him a lot of coin.

Name: Bear With Us
Content: An impoverished family has hunted a huge bear, but they are not able to skin it properly. They promise you the leather if you leave them the food.

Name: Sorka and the Mists
Content: You have to convince Sorka to meet Leonidas. In your opinion, he is best placed to help her.
ResultConclusion:
Sorka accepts your explanation and promises to go meet Leonidas. To your surprise, she then immediately leaves the cave and marches towards the Forest of Revelation with a determined gait.

Finn gives you a knowing smile and you understand that Sorka is not made for long-term alliances.

Before departing, she left you a package. You will have to remember to thank her later when the paths of your adventures cross once more.

Name: Panorama: Ridand'hok Hills
Content: This seems like a suitable place for you to use your Lantern to scan the region.

Name: Park and Ridand'hok
Content: On your arrival, no boat is moored at the quay.
Introduction: Caravaneers need brave travellers to deliver cargo to the guild's secret dock in Ridand'hok.

Name: A Time for the Dead
Content: After explaining that he and Atora followed the trail of the living dead to an ancient cemetery, Matteus admitted that he had no ideas as to the next step and therefore is happy to let you take the lead.
ResultConclusion: Back at Matteus's Woodcutters Hut, you present your findings to the couple. Atora and Matteus thank you for your work but admit that it's all pretty thin on substance. However, after all your discussions, you do have at least a few clues to work with.

Name: A distant corrupted memory, Volume 5
Content: The runes invoke a memory that you must face alone.

Name: Canine duel
Content: A giant vargr tarzakomor stands on a rock, awaiting a challenge worthy of its might. You quickly understand that it is one of your good friends that he is waiting for.
ResultConclusion: Ovie loses the duel, but he defends himself with honor. You understand that his enemy let Ovie live so that he would return when he was ready.

Name: A Desirable Neighbourhood
Content: The people of the Lunar Caravan want to settle near Esquire Lake. However, you know that the Black Horse Pavilion is nearby and that might displease the Order of the Hippogriff.

Name: The Prerequisites of Training
Content: You need to create three versions of the Engineer Mallet to be able to complete the training.

Name: Ralouf's second debt
Content: Serums are expensive beverages. It is normal for Rakham to want them back.
Introduction: Concoct and bring the serums to Rakham in order to pay Ralouf's debt.
ResultConclusion: Rakham seems greatly pleased with the new serums he can now add to his collection. He thanks you and confirms that a druid is already on his way to Ralouf's residence.

Name: The Lost
Content: A lost walking group offers you a reward for getting them out of the forest.

Name: The Over-Encumbered Hunter
Content: You meet a hunter who has just made the catch of a lifetime. He is not sure what to do with his excess inventory.

Name: Eau de Worm
Content: You have arrived at the other side of the Eligratine, safe and sound.
Introduction: You attempt to get Milounala across the Eligratine. She reeks of a scent that attracts giant worms.
ResultConclusion:
Milounala thanks you for your protection. She will be able to walk the rest of the way on her own. She will return to the Arcanists to find a way to get rid of the smell. 

Before leaving, she hands you a vial of perfume as a reward.

Name: A Fabricated Dilemma
Content: Some guards have stumbled upon an abandoned shipment of fabric. They're clearly unsure what to do with it. Is one person's loss another's opportunity?

Name: A Place of Refuge
Content: Protectors use temporary encampments to provide refuge and aid for citizens in need.
Hint: Progress of this questline: {0}/{1}

Name: Mystery of the Maranchons
Content: You see what appears to be an ancient plinth which looks as if it could crumble in just a gentle breeze. Despite its fragile state, you sense a weak magical aura escaping from it. Investigating its surroundings may uncover some clues.

Name: An obscure delivery
Content: You find it hard to believe, but this is where one of the packages should be delivered.

Name: Staff Mastery
Content: You are in the tower library seeking to expand your knowledge on the usage of combat staves.
ResultConclusion: Your studies were particularly instructive and educational. You already feel more capable. Now all that remains is commencement of the practical work.

Name: Mysterious Oil
Content:
Despite Calista's obvious reluctance, she eventually explains that she can actually make the oil required by Rhys Pair. However, it must be prepared at a specific time of the year and it should be used quickly after its concoction. 

To complete the oil, she needs several ingredients. You should talk with her to find out their details.
Introduction: Rhys Pair explained to you that you will have to go to the Malarcane Forest to find the person who can prepare his oil.

Name: The Collector's Machine
Content: The collector owns a gigantic machine that often needs replacement parts. The machine is said to be hovering over Strata Obseka.

Name: Worms of the Drylands
Content: Sand worms,  each as long as your foot, move at high speeds through the vicinity. Catching one would allow you to study them.
ResultConclusion: Once caught, the worms dissolve into a fine powder. Whether they are a natural phenomenon or a magical creation of some kind, you can't be sure.

Name: The Beast from Nowhere
Content:
Whenever you get to this area of the marsh, a strange creature charges at you from nowhere and slams you to the ground before bounding off deeper into the forest.

This time, you're ready to resist its charge.
ResultConclusion: The creature falls and drops some objects. It is with great pride that you pick up your meagre booty.

Name: "A chest!"
Content: A small chest is there. As if it were waiting for you. Classic.

Name: The Stubborn Duo
Content: Two travellers accuse each other of having stolen the other's goods.

Name: First Trip to Kortombourg
Content:
You have finally arrived in Kortombourg. On your journey, you saw plants, animals, and people who differed greatly to anything you've known in Valsonge. 

The promise of learning more about this strange new place fills you with excitement.
Introduction: Leonidas explained the best route to follow to get to Kortombourg. You picked up your gear and set off on your first big adventure.

Name: Prisoner of Mud
Content:
Varko has asked you to take care of his cart before you start looking for his bodyguard. It may seem strange to you as a priority, but you don't really have much choice in the matter. 

Regardless, you should find a way to fix it as quickly as possible.
ResultIntroduction: Varko thanks you for your precious help, then admits to worrying about Finn Vorel, his bodyguard, who left to seek help.

Name: Pyram Terror
Content: Two red eyes glow amidst the flames fixating on anything that approaches the fire barrier.
Introduction: The flames of the fire barrier have diminished. The guild's scouts spotted a hellish being covered in flames moving into the centre of the barrier to reinforce it.

Name: An Epidemic of Nightmares
Content: You're puzzled by the peculiar and still unsolved outbreak of nightmares gripping Kortombe. Authorities have yet to find the culprit.

Name: Ecology of Manynotes
Content: Something isn't right in Manynotes Forest. Creatures there are more hostile than usual.
Introduction: You have been asked to learn more about the creatures attacking travellers near Manynotes Forest.
ResultConclusion: It would appear that an invasive plant is reducing the amount of food available in the forest. Competition and necessity have led the native creatures to aggression. At least, that's the conclusion you draw from your amateur ecological inspection.

Name: The Cold Tree
Content: To your amazement, you notice that one tree is blanketed in snow while all the others are not.
ResultConclusion: You find no explanation or rune that would account for the phenomenon. Your best guess? A fairy must live in the tree.

Name: Practice Weapons for the People
Content: The weapons in the people's armoury wear out too quickly. Officials are looking for craftsmen to provide better practice weapons.
Hint: Progress of this questline: {0}/{1}

Name: The Search of the Whispers
Content: On the ground near the plinth, you discover a plaque upon which a message is written: "Standing at the foot of a fall, overlooking the sword, inside the moon."

Name: The foundations of the outpost
Content:
You arrive at the scene of a former military outpost seemingly abandoned a few decades prior. 

You notice the masonry on the outposts' foundations appears much older than that on the surface. 

An inspection should tell you more.

Name: The "Dramatic" Posts of the Vortex
Content: Sorik is a wise and informed teacher, but you have learn to endure his never-ending anecdotes. You mentally prepare to spend long hours learning more about vortices.
ResultConclusion: After all this study, Sorik explains that you can now create channels in your workshops and transport them to the Sorcerer's Vortex.

Name: The Spy who was Spied Upon
Content: Having arrived in front of the house, you decide what strategy to take to learn more about this supposed killer.
Introduction: Constantly checking over your shoulder to ensure you're not being tailed, you decide to return to Ector to clear things up.
ResultConclusion: Following your mission, Ector informs you that he might need you again for some more espionage.

Name: The Fruity Monster
Content: You have agreed to deliver a shipment of fruit to The Monster of Gargagoth. The tavern, not the real monster.
Introduction: You must deliver the fruits to The Monster of Gargagoth
ResultConclusion: Fortunately, the cold climate of Gantras helped maintain the quality of the fruit.

Name: Revenge
Content: Multoran invites you to join in his quest for vengeance in the Leviathan Hills. You'll have to describe your prowess to him.
Introduction: The patrol was in the hills when they were attacked.

Name: Dismantling the Herbarium
Content:
You find the herbarium to be in an especially sorry state. 

At least that means there's less to carry back.
Introduction: Ouab tells you where his old herbarium is. You will need a good enough cart to transport the remnants of the building.

Name: Unheroic Trash
Content: As Leonidas told you, explorers left vials behind. Now all you have to do is find enough of them to allow him to repair your Lantern.
Introduction: Leonidas has asked you to bring him some vials so he can use them to repair the glass of your Lantern. You'll find some in the woods near your current location.
ResultConclusion:
You have traversed the forest for some time in search of vials. However, you cannot find enough to repair the Lantern.

You notice that Adventurer Sorka has returned to her camp. Maybe she could help you.

Name: Undercover
Content: In addition to berry production, the estate offers a home-call botanist service. You are trying to become a substitute so you can be assigned to the House of the Setting Sun.
Introduction: Ector had already formed a plan for your infiltration. First, you'll need to become an employee for Enchanfruits. Visit the day-manager to progress to the next stage of the plan.
ResultConclusion: Becoming a substitute botanist was the easy part, now you need to infiltrate the House of the Setting Sun.

Name: Zorburrin Negotiations
Content: As soon as you arrive at the meeting place, you understand that this will not be a friendly encounter. The famous Shazazes look ready for war.
Introduction: You must accompany Zorkaza to meet the Zorburrs. You suspect it's a trap.
ResultConclusion:
Following your adventure, you disbelieve the story of the curse. Zorburrs naturally have evil spirits. If there were more of them, Larcen would surely already be burning. 

Zorkaza leaves your group greatly disappointed with the result.

Name: Totems and Termites
Content: As you arrive, you notice tiny insects gnawing through the wooden totem pole with incredible speed. You notify Cletus of the problem, but he just shrugs his shoulders, seemingly unbothered about the destructive critters.
Introduction: Imported directly from the savannas of Jakodisnol, the totem must be delivered in tip-top condition to one Cletus Delabouette. He lives in the depths of the Rimouskan Lands.
ResultConclusion: You make sure that no bugs are eating your cart or the rest of your merchandise.

Name: The Position of the Alderman
Content: It's clear what the alderman is saying can't be true. You should discover if he's in cahoots with Durong's gang, or whether he's just incompetent.

Name: In the Heart of the Forest
Content: A hollow tree catches your eye.

Name: An Alchemist's First Steps
Content: Wynael has given you a list of strange substances to bring back.

Name: Canine Reprisals
Content: The creature is not in its lair. You should take advantage of that by laying a trap to defeat the vicious beast upon its return. Ovie must be with you to complete this adventure.
ResultConclusion:
Ovie is now avenged. To remind you of your first adventure companion, you receive the young Ovie minion.

Congratulations!

Name: The Collector's Armor
Content: The Collector's Armory is said to span a dungeon twenty stories high. Armor is even said to animate and attack you if you step into it.

Name: The madness of the Silus
Content: You are in the area where the crazy Silus have fled. You can start your investigation.
Introduction: The mad Silus are said to have gone north after the attack.

Name: The Dark Crevasse
Content: You notice something at the bottom of a crevasse; it looks like a piece of fabric. Reaching it will not be easy.

Name: The Great Protector
Content:
You arrive at your destination, but to your surprise, everything seems peaceful. Too peaceful. The only movement is a fox cub playing with a human bone. 

Suddenly, the little animal drops its plaything and takes flight. It's time to draw your weapons.
Introduction: The Great Protector is located in Manynotes Forest.
ResultIntroduction: Once the Great Protector is defeated, Rhavina can begin designing the rune using the residual energy of the sylvan creature.

Name: Diplomatic Advice
Content: Celeste prepares for her next diplomatic meetings. As you have helped her a lot in the past, she asks for your opinion on some matters related to the guilds of Ordval.
ResultConclusion: Celeste thanks you for your advice and invites you to come back and share your opinions on the guilds a little later.

Name: Forged Courage
Content: Lorne is attempting to secretly arm the clans of Enorwen so that they will be less intimidated by Durong Talos and his gang. You could discreetly provide him with some weapons.
Hint: Progress of this questline: {0}/{1}

Name: The Elorinal Coat of Arms
Content: A special ceremony requires a coat of arms made of elorinal, a rare metal that can be found on the Argistant Plateau. Florentina will reward any adventurer who brings it to the guild.

Name: The Knights' Armoury
Content: Being well equipped in armour is a priority for the people of the Rose. The armoury constantly needs new gear for its knights.
Hint: Progress of this questline: {0}/{1}

Name: The Hollow Tree
Content: You notice a hole at the top of one of the forest trees. Surely there is something hidden in there!

Name: The Crushed Cart
Content: Part of the cliff has collapsed, crashing down on a large transport cart carrying stones. The cart's drivers do not seem to have survived.

Name: Gremfyrs in the Barn
Content: The presence of gremfyrs is evident. You prepare to enter the barn.
Introduction: You must go to the Dufanni farm to visit the grand barn.
ResultConclusion: Following an impressive demonstration of your weaponry, the gremfyrs will undoubtedly find themselves another place to live.

Name: Fortified Drinking Troughs
Content: Mily has managed to convince you to provide her with a set of drinking troughs for her future "tenants".
ResultConclusion:
Once delivered, you took the time to help Mily install the drinking troughs. This allowed you to study the cages she uses and, ironically, she wasn't all that cagey about her construction secrets. 

You're now sure that you could construct such an enclosure in your own domain.

Name: Extraction Mastery
Content: You are ready to perform the ritual of extraction.

Name: Gildiro Gem Recipient
Content: Gildiro Resonardo Need Gem Resonance Experiment A345 Version 4 Post Regulation.
Hint: Progress of this questline: {0}/{1}

Name: Where the Sun Doesn't Shine
Content: The cliffs here are riddled with hundreds of caves. The creeping vegetation of the forest has scaled the cliffs and infiltrated the caves. It is said that a passage is hidden somewhere nearby. Will you have the talent to find it?

Name: Stratram Terror
Content: A being floats amid the wind barrier. If anyone comes close, the creature's stinger shoots violently out of the barrier in their direction.
Introduction: The influence of the Elemental Plane of Stratram has diminished in Garrun'gol. It is now possible to get closer to the wind barrier. Close enough indeed to see the terrible creature guarding the passage.

Name: A Fatal Fall
Content: Looks like a boulder rolled down the cliff and crushed a den where a family of animals lived. A sad story indeed; better check for survivors.

Name: Finding Choubard
Content: Sorik seems so used to not talking about the Mist World that he completely ignores the fact that you have a Lantern like Leonidas's.
Introduction: Leonidas informs you that his former companion would be studying a rock south of Kortombe.

Name: Collaboration.2432.Collector
Content: Search.Crest.Collector.Exchange.Information.

Name: Hidden Creatures
Content: Jullus would like to learn more about the creatures that hide in forests, mountains and swamps. Can you provide him with the information he desires today?
Hint: This quest can be done every day. It does not influence your reputation progress.

Name: Fabrics for the Dolmono
Content: You have decided to help the children of the Dolmono family to create their imposing land boat project.
ResultConclusion:
The Dolmono's mother comes to thank you personally for the help you have given to her children.

She hands you a pile of bandages she made from scraps of fabric from the teens' project.

Name: A Mistpiercer
Content: You have found a Mistpiercer, a machine capable of sowing chaos if misused. To destroy it, you will need to first face its guardians.

Name: Woodworking Mastery
Content: You have agreed to produce an ociosto wood creation for Oliveri's new ship.
ResultConclusion:
Oliveri is very satisfied with your work.

You even receive a missive a few days later informing you that for once, his boat did not sink when launched.

Name: Initiation of the Claw: The Assassins
Content: To understand the strength of numbers in battle, Warriors of the Claw will have to learn how to counter small foes that attack en masse. The amphibious assassins of Thousandshirts will show you the way.
Introduction: You must find the lair of the amphibious assassins to complete one of the challenges of the Claw. Arachnidic caviar must be brought back as proof of your success.
ResultConclusion: An old lady comes to retrieve the caviar. You hope it won't be used for cooking.

Name: Stratram Purification
Content: The number of creatures linked to the air element must be reduced in the caverns.

Name: Making Apparitions Disappear
Content: Maratatinus is awaiting your report on the creatures in the Living Ruins.
Introduction: You must return to the Living Ruins at night to fight the apparitions and find out more about their weaknesses.
ResultConclusion:
Following your report, Maratatinus touches you with a golden leaf. He explains that this ceremony makes you an acolyte member of the guild.

This will allow you to find the Sanctuary of Eternity.

Name: Machines for the Multiforge
Content: One of the old artisanal craft buildings is in dire need of new machinery. Craftspeople are required to create these specialized machines.
Hint: Progress of this questline: {0}/{1}

Name: The Wood Samaritan
Content: A footbridge used to help the carts cross the region is broken. A group is attempting to repair it. You could help them in case they have a surplus of wood.

Name: Plains Creatures
Content: Jullus is looking for information on the effectiveness of combat techniques against certain creatures. Maybe you can help him today?
Hint: This quest can be done every day. It does not influence your reputation progress.

Name: Dreadful Spirits
Content: At night, a group of spirits terrorize the people of the neighbourhood with their demonic cries. Banish them back to their world.
ResultConclusion: People in the neighbourhood will now be able to sleep a little better. Assuming there's no snoring oryctus around.

Name: Beating the Bear
Content: You must win a fight against a bear in order to prove your fighting skills to the Claw Assembly.
ResultConclusion:
Just as you are about to land the killing blow, a horn sounds, causing you to hold back.

The bear is strangely calmed by the sound of the horn. He turns around as if nothing had happened then rather jovially bounds back towards a cage near the camp.

Name: Ruin of the Living Wall
Content: You have found a ruin in the Living Wall.

Name: At Map's End
Content: A promising student from Korllights Academy was mapping the area, but he has no more paper to go further north. He asks for your help.
ResultConclusion: You explained to him that he should just use the bottom of his paper instead of the top. Then he can do some cutting and gluing when he returns to the academy.

Name: Ridiculous Mountains Evacuation
Content: When it rains, the Ridiculous Mountains evacuate water through cavities located in the cliff. You think this water might be carrying objects of interest.

Name: The Insecure and Incomprehensible Bandit
Content:
A short man jumps out of the bushes at the side of the road ahead. While standing straight in front of you, he bellows angry words at you while wielding a hand weapon. 

His few words are made incomprehensible by his accent and the mask covering his mouth. He's obviously a bandit. 

You could fight him, but there is likely another solution.

Name: A Special Project
Content: The marble factory is currently buying stone for a project. The stone must be delivered in good condition, directly to the marble factory.
Hint: Progress of this questline: {0}/{1}

Name: A Mistpiercer
Content: You have found a Mistpiercer, a machine capable of sowing chaos if misused. To destroy it, you will need to first face its guardians.

Name: Broken Branches
Content: There are broken branches on the ground, as if there was a recent struggle.

Name: Claw Challenge: Tortolus, solo
Content: You now find yourself in front of Tortolus's lair. You signal to your companions to stay back while you prepare for battle.
Introduction: You must make your way to the windy escarpment where you will face Tortolus alone. Fortunately, your companions may accompany you on your journey.

Name: Vorf's Error
Content: Vorf finally realizes that something is wrong. You get the distinct impression that he's about to expel you from his home with his pack of sandvargrs.
ResultConclusion: Vorf eventually calms down and explains what's going on.

Name: The Suspicious Clearing
Content: You have a bad feeling about this clearing. Perhaps it is a meeting point for illegal activities.

Name: Colour for a Powder
Content: Here is the powder of the day.
Hint: This daily quest has no success limit. This daily quest will give you access to other quests depending on your number of successes.

Name: World's End Relay
Content: Despite its secluded location, the place is packed. You must now find Carl in this crowd.
Introduction: Sergeant Carl has asked you to meet him at World's End Relay.
ResultConclusion: You find the sergeant sitting alone at a table. He beckons you to approach.

Name: Squeak Pass
Content: The terrible Squeak Pass is in front of you. It is one of the most difficult passes in the whole of the realm. The people of Gantras made a series of pictograms explaining the best way through. This information could be very useful to you.

Name: The totem of the West
Content: You are in front of the totem. You suddenly realize that Sorka hasn't told you anything about what she meant by "activating the totem."
Introduction: Sorka asked you to go and activate a totem that would be in this region.
ResultIntroduction:
Just as the two totems are active, a beam of light hits the large waterfall to the north.

In the distance, you see Sorka running towards the falls. It seems she didn't have any plans to wait for your return.

Name: The Collector's Jewels
Content: The Collector exports jewelry across the continent. Some of his clients have very specific requests that require highly talented craftsmen. Like you?

Name: Just Enough to Survive
Content: Ulrick would like to provide basic weaponry for members of his expeditions. Nothing fancy.

Name: Replacing Jill
Content: Cover young Jill's hunting and botany duties as she recovers from her encounter with the Brumedor Troll.

Name: An Ancient Camp
Content: There seems to have been a camp here long in the past. A site inspection may tell you more.

Name: Calming Spirits
Content: Following the discovery of documents concerning the Kortombe family, many citizens expressed concern. The baroness asked you to calm the population. It's up to you how you go about it.
ResultIntroduction:
Relene Kortombe listens carefully to your report and then thanks you for your work. 

For her part, she asked her advisers to authenticate the documents you found in the crypt. She confirms that Annabelle's diary is truthful, though there are some abnormalities. Most strangely, the signature on the painting and some hateful messages written in Reinfort's texts look alike, but were not written by the same hand who wrote the bulk of the documents.

Name: New quest full daily index
Content: Thou shall do something.

Name: The strange mechanism
Content: You found a strange ruin near the inner lake.

Name: Special Decorations
Content: The Marquee requires rarer substances for decorating around the seats of the esteemed Gorathan family.
Hint: Progress of this questline: {0}/{1}

Name: The Screaming Ladies
Content: Travellers are frightened at night when they pass near the Woodlands of the Dryads. The screams that echo through the leaves sound supernatural.
Introduction: Rendezvous at night in the Woodlands of the Dryads, in order to rid the region of the "screaming ladies".

Name: The Forest Garden
Content: Students from Korllights decided to make a garden in the heart of Bonarcane. The result has been disastrous. After their departure, only a few plants have survived.

Name: Back to Calista
Content: You are now back in the Sylvan Estate. It is time to give the gossiping flower to Calista so she can whip up the oil asked for by Rhys Pair.
Introduction: You must now return to Calista to give her the gossiping flower and ask her for information on the next steps.

Name: Reaching the Sanctuary
Content: Once at the shrine, Rackham welcomes you. He already knows that you have spoken with Maratatinus and wishes to have more details about the Living Ruins.
Introduction: You must find the entrance to the secret path leading to the Sanctuary of Eternity. It is located somewhere around the forest of Norkantas.
ResultConclusion: Rackham listens carefully to your story.

Name: The exchange of minoris poisons
Content: Rolonet explains to you, in his strange language, that he makes much more profit on poor quality poisons. He is willing to trade you minoris poisons for a better poison.
Hint: This daily scenario is for your companions' enchantments.

Name: The exchange of minoris mechanisms
Content: Garim constantly needs parts for his automated forge projects. He is willing to trade you simple mechanics for more complex mechanics.
Hint: This daily scenario is for your companions' enchantments.

Name: Initiation of the Claw: The Fauna of Irlandun
Content: Around the Marquee, solitary creatures change with the cycle of the sun. Learn how to live by day and how to survive by night.
Introduction: You must face the creatures of the canyon by day and by night.

Name: The Trapped Totem
Content: A totem is installed on the edge of the cliff. A quick inspection reveals that it's trapped and  might explode if touched. You must find a way to defuse the trap!

Name: Snakes in a Park
Content: The populace of Aranbourg seeks aid ridding their park of a nest of vicious snakes.
Introduction: Anvar tells you where the nest is.
ResultConclusion:
Anvar, who was watching you from afar, approaches and gives you the promised reward. 

You understand that these are personal goods coming directly from common people who have rallied together to better their community.

Name: A Miner Task
Content: Umphric Podor has shown you large cases that he hopes you will transport to Forsec Mine. Now you have to decide how to transport them.

Name: A Rock or a Ruin?
Content: You notice a large straight-edged rock which could be the ruin of an ancient temple. You have no idea if that's the case, but getting to the bottom of it could be helpful.

Name: Bows for the Silus
Content: Fah' Poki is doing her half of the job.
Introduction: Fah' Poki must craft bows for the young Silus. She asked you to help her.

Name: The source of the madness
Content: On the shore of the lake, you can see a large wooden totem. When you approach it, you feel a kind of attraction, as if it is calling you.
Introduction: The crazy Silus had returned from a hunting trip near the lake in the center of the forest. The source of their madness is surely there.

Name: Rolonet the hermit
Content: When you enter the tower, you see a man sitting at a table covered in strange ingredients. He turns around and looks at you.
Introduction: Rolonet should apparently be able to assist you in your investigation. Bring him the totem's ashes at Saroskor'nak Tower.

Name: Metal Rain
Content: A very strange scene awaits you. Dozens, if not hundreds, of small golden metal spikes are planted in the ground as if they had fallen from the sky. Could this have something to do with the legendary Larfungel?

Name: As Light as Paper
Content:
In a clearing, you come across a hooded old woman standing next to a huge pile of papyrus. 

She offers you a most peculiar challenge. Providing you can carry all of her papyrus in one go, you can keep it all.

Name: A Red Spot on a Rock
Content: There is something unusual on an out-of-reach rock, how will you get to it?

Name: Letter to Aranbourg
Content: A letter for Leovia at the Aranbourg Market.
Introduction: Go to Aranbourg to deliver the letter to Leovia, at the market.

Name: A Lost Chest
Content: You have found a lost chest.

Name: A New Workshop
Content: The site team asks you to bring the materials necessary for the construction of the new workshop. In exchange, they will share with you the secrets of a quality workshop.
ResultConclusion: The training was most beneficial, without it you would have made loads of mistakes when adding a workshop in your domain.

Name: The Forest's Edge
Content: In the hope of finding a shortcut to the road that would circumvent the forest, a group of travellers followed the cliff-edge. Unfortunately, that is an impossible feat. They'll now need your help for the rest of their excursion.

Name: Misty Totem
Content: A totem lets out a magic mist that strangely resembles that of Valsonge. Could it be a vortex? Or is it a trap?

Name: Find the trogulnus
Introduction: The trogulnus fled to the northeast.

Name: Patrolling in Arnogo
Content: You arrive, and now must explore the surroundings to look for traces of cylmos.
Introduction: Your first scout mission for Tynas is in Arnogo Passage. Your map is marked with the location you must patrol.
ResultConclusion: You have found traces of cylmos in the area. You can report back to Tynas when you return to the fort.

Name: Block the tunnel
Content: You find a tunnel large enough for a tortolion to pass through. This is probably the one you need to block.
Introduction: Ulio Gavelio has asked you to return to the mine and block the tunnel through which the tortolions arrived.
ResultConclusion: Tortolions should no longer be a problem. For now.

Name: Badouk's Blunder
Content: Badouk is chained up in front of you, and you approach him to help.
Introduction: You have learned that Badouk will likely be in the Lithofortress. Explore the place to find him.
ResultIntroduction:
You were expecting to have to break Badouk's chains or search the keyrings of every guard. Fortunately, you realize that the keeper's key also works in this lock.

You have saved yourself from having to do another "Find the lost key" quest! Oh, and you've saved Badouk!

Name: Colour for a Substance
Content: Here's the substance of the day.
Hint: This daily quest has no success limit. This daily quest will give you access to other quests depending on your number of successes.

Name: Clarifying with Fabien
Content: You are certain that Fabien is hiding something from you. You have to make him talk.

Name: Leather Mastery
Content: You have agreed to produce some leatherwork for Anya. It will be used as a decoration for a showcase in Maliken displaying her finest jewellery.
ResultConclusion:
You delivered your creation just in time for the departure of the new collection to Maliken.

Anya seems happy with your handiwork, though she's visibly anxious about the Maliken high nobility's opinion of her jewellery.

Name: Strange Rain
Content: As you arrive in your new surroundings, you have the strange feeling that something is not quite right.
ResultConclusion:
Incredible! You realise that the drops of rainwater never actually touch the ground here. Before ever hitting the earth, they change direction and return to the sky!

Another strange phenomenon that is surely fairies' doing!

Name: The Swamp Tribe
Content: You strive to learn more about the Klotoss so that you can back up your suspicions that they are peaceful and pose no threat.
ResultConclusion: The Klotoss have no military capability. You understand that the tribe lives by hunting and that their only defence is flight.

Name: Vigilance at Thorval
Content: You believe that the Thorval Vigilance Camp, inhabited with those from Maliken, is worthy of suspicion. What's more, you have not yet found a slavery network in your adventures.

Name: The Pack
Content: A pack of vargrs has settled at the edge of the forest. It would surely be wise to dislodge them so that they return to the forest depths. That way, you can be sure passing travellers will be safe and, of course, you will be able to access the treasure chest located right in the middle of their lair.

Name: Rare Ore
Content: A valuable ore looks to be embedded between the cliff and the river below. Reaching it will be tricky. Re-ascending without dropping it will be even trickier.

Name: Answering to Justice
Content: You must respond in a way that will satisfy the guards at the Gate of Justice without revealing too much about where you came from.
ResultConclusion: Satisfied with your answers, the guard writes a note in a notebook. The great gates are now open to you, providing access to the Astridiel Valley.

Name: Destination Forsec
Content: When you arrive in Forsec, the supervisor tells you where to drop off your cargo.
Introduction: After picking up the cases and preparing your expedition, you must leave in the direction of Forsec. Once there, you will drop off the cargo and receive your wages.
ResultConclusion: Once the last case of tools has been placed on the ground, the supervisor hands you your pay. You take a few minutes to rest and chat with the miners, then set off for new adventures.

Name: Cousin Verdant
Content: You believe the fact that a cousin of Sir Tarul Verdant is at Notroll Camp is of interest.

Name: Mists at the foot of the cliffs
Content: You feel the presence of mists in the area.

Name: Multitools for the Multiforge
Content: Charles asks you to bring various workshop tools to the Multiforge to prove that you are truly versed in the art of crafting.

Name: The Stratram Nexus
Content: The air around you is charged with energy. The presence of Elhoaxiry is palpable. There will be nothing to study here. Prepare for battle.
Introduction: Your group has been chosen to study the nexus where the terrible elemental lord Elhoaxiry is located. No other Arcanists are allowed to approach until you secure the site.
ResultConclusion: After your fight, you perceive a weakening in the power of the elemental nexus. For the time being, the lord has been pushed back.

Name: Panorama: Zonktus Plateau
Content: This seems like a suitable place for you to use your Lantern to scan the region.

Name: The Halberd in the Boulder
Content: An impressive halberd is trapped inside of a rock. Will you be able to free it from its prison of stone?
ResultConclusion: Unfortunately, no one was there to see your mighty achievement.

Name: A Lost Chest
Content: You have found a lost chest. However, it is guarded by a creature. You will need to fight it first.

Name: Gargar's Introspection
Content: You suddenly feel imbued with an energy from ancient times. You know that this would be a good place to collect yourself and gather your thoughts.
ResultConclusion: You do not yet fully understand the energy of this cave, but you are invigorated with renewed confidence. You have the conviction that you will one day reach the highest peaks and the deepest abysses.

Name: The Good Grave
Content: Now that you know a little more about what could be the cause of the echoing spirits of the ruin, you set out to defeat the creatures that haunt the place and find the source of the corruption.
ResultConclusion: Your studies direct you to a place containing several ancient tombstones.

Name: Preparations for Dunedan
Content: You prepare to traverse the tunnel system with Finn and Sorka. It will not be an easy task for the trail is dangerous and time is short.
ResultConclusion: You are ready! The team waits for the right time and prepares to cross.

Name: Artless Dodgers
Content: Find information on the indiscreet thieves in Dalitan Valley.
Introduction: Indiscreet thieves are operating from Dalitan Valley.

Name: Rayth's Wrath
Content: Rakham awaits your report on the Swamp of Ruins.
Introduction: You have decided to defeat the guardian of the burial chamber to better understand its origins.
ResultConclusion:
Rakham listens to your report with interest.

He tells you that he will need some time to get the council's approval before he sends you onwards to the remaining ruins.

Name: Urban Delivery
Content: Once you arrive in the centre of Kortombourg, you hand the package to the clerk who takes care of the Raul Despommiers' kiosk.
Introduction: Raul Despommiers gives you directions to get to Kortombourg Market. You pick up the packet of dried meat and prepare to leave.
ResultConclusion: After receiving your salary, you asked the clerk where the store selling the best clothes was located, so that you could properly explore the seigneury. He suggested you go talk directly with Umphric Podor.

Name: The Hydram Nexus
Content: Through the nexus, you can sense Glixiri's presence. Your academic excursion has been cut short. Prepare for battle.
Introduction: Your group has been chosen to study the nexus where the terrible elemental lord Glixiri is located. No other Arcanists are allowed to approach until you secure the site.
ResultConclusion: After your fight, you perceive a weakening in the power of the elemental nexus. For the time being, the lord has been pushed back.

Name: The Dying Plant
Content: Having arrived in the murky marshlands, the plant already seems in better shape than when you received it in the mountains.
Introduction: You must escort a strange animated plant to Tarinna Marsh.
ResultConclusion:
The plant sinks into the swamp and begins to devour the flies around her.

Let's hope she never grows up to become an adventurer-eater.

Name: Trapped
Content: Some poachers are not lacking in audacity. Imagine that one of them set traps near here. I destroyed these traps yesterday, but I am afraid that he did it again. Can you search around the wood near the manor to make sure that no animals got caught in their traps?
ResultConclusion: Unfortunately, you failed to save the partridge, but you can still get some meat from its freshly killed body.

Name: Mystery of the Sleeping
Content: You see what appears to be an ancient plinth which looks as if it could crumble in just a gentle breeze. Despite its fragile state, you sense a weak magical aura escaping from it. Investigating its surroundings may uncover some clues.

Name: Ruins of Prettybard Portal
Content: You are standing in front of the ruins, looking for a way to activate the portal.

Name: Initiation of the Claw: Tortolus
Content: A creature named Tortolus resides in the Ridiculous Mountains. A Warrior of the Claw must learn how to pierce armoured carapaces.
Introduction: You must search for Tortolus's lair in the Ridiculous Mountains for the Claw Challenge.

Name: Quicksand
Content: A man screams for help: he is sinking deeper and deeper into quicksand!
ResultConclusion: The man grabs the stick and you manage to get him out of the sands after a long sustained effort. He thanks you greatly and hands you a purse as a reward for saving his life.

Name: Learning of the Kofo-Lun
Content: A bit like yourself, these Kofo-Lun are mysterious newcomers. You are trying to figure out who they really are.

Name: The pursuit of the clone
Content: On the ground, you can see a pile of clothes charred by a purple-coloured magical fire. Some parts of the clothes are still burning.
Introduction: Before you can even move, Baloin disappears in a cloud to reappear at the bottom of the steps, he then flees towards the well.

Name: Anodina for Tara
Content: To do Tara a favour, or just to prove her wrong, you have decided to go get her plants. They should be south of the Forest of Whispers.
ResultConclusion:
Tara doesn't say a word as she takes the plants you offer her.

Though you do notice she seems at least a little more calm and relieved.

Name: Scarpel and Wonta
Content: Serocca has asked you to acquire rare resources. She will offer you training in exchange.

Name: Climbing Lessons
Content: Yol asks for payment for your training and equipment before you begin your lessons.

Name: An Evil Cult in the Glade?
Content: A large bed of straw has been constructed on a rocky cape. The smallest of embers could ignite it into an inferno. You believe you've found a location where evil activities or sacrificial rituals take place. You'll have to deploy a little subterfuge to learn more.
ResultConclusion: Without going into the sordid details, after watching the start of the spectacle, you soon understood that what happens there is not cult related after all. It's of a more intimate nature. You slip away in the greatest silence...

Name: Debris in the Delta
Content: Debris has accumulated on the banks of the delta. It may be that there's rare wood there from the Wise Forest that you could collect before it disappears into the Irroudanadouls Inland Sea.

Name: The Mistpiercer Grimalis
Content: Students from Korllights Academy are attempting to look through the Mists with a special telescope. You know full well that the project will never work, but will you be able to convince them?

Name: The Pyram Nexus
Content: In the very heart of the lava, you can see the terrifying silhouette of Xiryhaxi. You quickly understand that the pen will not be mightier than the sword here. Prepare for battle.
Introduction: Your group has been chosen to study the nexus where the terrible elemental lord Xiryhaxi is located. No other Arcanists are allowed to approach until you secure the site.
ResultConclusion: After your fight, you perceive a weakening in the power of the elemental nexus. For the time being, the lord has been pushed back.

Name: The Lion's Share
Content: A lone hero appears to have fallen foul of a lion attack. Do you dare search the remains of the unfortunate man?

Name: The Misfortune of Jovien the Happy
Content: Jovien appears to be hiding something from you. You decide that the best way to find out more is to help him fix his treasured mill.

Name: Cross to Dunedan
Content: Crossing the hazardous underground caverns with Sorka and Finn is not easy, but you progress.

Name: Fairy powders
Content: The Healing Fairy, coming directly from the Fairy Forest, prepares the best potions of Bonvoisin! Meet me directly at the hostel.
Hint: This daily quest can be completed 25 times.

Name: Hunting Mastery
Content: You are ready to perform the ancient ritual of the hunt.

Name: Totem Recall
Content: Is it possible that gremfyrs build giant totems? Well, if this is the case, this totem uses highly desirable premium quality wood. It would probably be better not to leave the totem intact, it could attract evil spirits, after all.

Name: The Mute
Content: A woman approaches you, but does not seem able to speak. You are trying to understand what she wants.
ResultConclusion: For all your good intentions, you didn't really understand. Though she left you a gift anyway, for your efforts.

Name: Leather for Fah' Poki
Content: Fah' Poki is sitting near her hut waiting for your return.
Introduction: Fah Poki would really like to have red, mounking and wodjik leather.

Name: "A dragon saddle?!"
Content:
Mangled in the swamp, you find what appears to be a gigantic saddle, far too big to fit a horse. 

There may be recoverable pieces.

Name: A Mistpiercer
Content: You have found a Mistpiercer, a machine capable of sowing chaos if misused. To destroy it, you will need to first face its guardians.

Name: The good citizen
Content: It is said that doing a good deed a day is a good way to become popular.

Name: Aeryn's Substances
Content: Aeryn Dool at the Inn of Tales is researching new substances for his decorations.
Hint: This weekly quest can be completed 10 times.

Name: Order for the Multiforge
Content: Today, the administrators of the Multiforge request the following items:
Hint: This quest will give you access to other quests depending on your number of successes. Progress of this questline: {0}/{1}

Name: Fish for Gontruk
Content: As you arrive at the quarry, Tranilda looks at you inquisitively and waits for you to unload your cart.
Introduction: You need to deliver fresh fish to Gontruk Quarry.
ResultConclusion: Tranilda sniffs the fish and seems delighted with your delivery.

Name: The Forest Labyrinth
Content: You arrive at a peculiar place in the forest. It looks like some kind of labyrinth created by a woodland entity. Can you meet the maze's challenge?

Name: Mystery of Corinna
Content: You see what appears to be an ancient plinth which looks as if it could crumble in just a gentle breeze. Despite its fragile state, you sense a weak magical aura escaping from it. Investigating its surroundings may uncover some clues.

Name: Crazy Animals
Content: After listening to Blanche, you decided to take an interest in the problems experienced by farmers in the region. Now you have to decide where to start.
ResultConclusion:
Blanche and Mauve thank you, but you notice that they are only more concerned. 

They have several questions about the source of the evil, but unfortunately you still have no real answers.

Name: Volcanic Study
Content: It is requested that all Arcanists able to enter Garrun'gol Volcano collect samples there for the analysis team.

Name: In the Shadow of Finordak
Content:
A strange altar was constructed here long ago. Judging by its position and markings, it was created by an ancient people for a ritual connected to Mount Finordak. 

Is there anything useful left on the site?

Name: The Out-of-Order Lithydrios
Content: Zarou is waiting for you with a form confirming the number of operators you were able to reset.
Introduction: Zarou asks you to reset the operators with your elemental magic.
ResultConclusion: Zarou informs you that the number of free operators is now at an acceptable level.

Name: Pestles and Mortars for Colours
Content: Miloue has asked you for different pestles and mortars for her dye house. She promised you some special colours in return.

Name: "I'm a druid!"
Content: A man pretends to be one of nature's protectors. He's really annoying the locals.

Name: Too Many Gremfyrs
Content: The number of caravan attacks in Prankster Hills has reached unacceptable levels. The authorities are offering a reward to anyone who helps reduce their numbers.
Introduction: The gremfyrs have been descending from Epirpon to Prankster Hills.

Name: Vorf's Canine Training
Content: Vorf focuses his training on Ovie's ability to fight, not alone, but as a complement to your fighting style.
ResultConclusion: It was terribly difficult training session, for all parties involved. Still, after a while, Vorf seems satisfied.

Name: [d] The traveling herbalist
Content: [d] You have arrived in the bulgrof forest. Now all we have to do is find these trees.
Introduction: [d] The man, an herbalist, would indeed appreciate your protection. He wants to go to the Bulgrof forest to find a grove of exotic trees.
ResultConclusion: [d] You finally find the grove. Bolli Verde thanks you and gives you a few crowns.

Name: Finding the Arcanists
Content: Yolasula shows you where the Cave of Knowledge is on your map. You will have to find a way to reach it.
Introduction: Yolasula shows you where the Cave of Knowledge is on your map. You will have to find a way to reach it.
ResultConclusion:
Zarou takes your parchment and lays it on a pile of similar forms as tall as a gremfyr.

You're very sceptical as to the chances of it ever being read there.

Name: An Apple a Day
Content: Pick some apples in the fields of Quara.

Name: A distant corrupted memory, Volume 9
Content: The runes invoke a memory that you must face alone.

Name: Ralouf's commission
Content: Zarou stares at you wondering what could be the reason for your visit.
Introduction: Ask Zarou to lend you the items needed for the ritual.

Name: Defeating Zhyxhu
Content: Leonidas has agreed to let you defeat Zhyxhu. Always the stoic, he knows full well that if you do fail, then the worst that will happen is for you to suffer horrendous pain before waking up again in your own home.
Introduction: Leonidas shows you the place you must scan the Mists to find the rift.

Name: The Trembling Tribal Totem
Content: A beautiful totem looks particularly unsturdy. Hopefully your inspection won't topple it.
ResultConclusion: The totem falls after all.

Name: The Apprentice's Tablet
Content: You are studying the creation of evocation tablets with the Arcanists. You must meet the specialists who will explain the details of their creation to you.

Name: The Ogre Hunt
Content: You have decided to help the scouts of the Kofo-Lun by hunting the giant ogres at the base of Mount Frokilkador.

Name: Ruins of the Durontuel Portal
Content: You are standing in front of the ruins, looking for a way to activate the portal.

Name: The Taming of the Fly
Content: You notice that flies act and react differently depending on the colours presented to them. You wonder what you could do with this phenomenon.
Hint: This creature can reach level 30 and requires a solidity 20 cage.

Name: A Bed Befitting a Noble
Content: Jahiri needs a very special bed for a new high-class client. He asks for your help creating this luxury piece of furniture.
Hint: Progress of this questline: {0}/{1}

Name: Illuminate Obscura
Content: You try to convince Deidre Obscura that you are the real group that Leighanna was supposed to meet.

Name: The Smell of Victory
Content: You need to find a water snake nest to execute Sorka's plan. You have a few reservations about the strategy.
Introduction: The chest Sorka wants is protected by a scary creature. You need to find a water snake nest to protect yourself from it.
ResultIntroduction:
With malicious pleasure, Sorka helps to coat you with the revolting smell of water snakes.

You thought she would do the same, but instead she smiles and draws her weapons.

Name: The Captain's Mace
Content:
Larcen's captain of the guard would like a new mace, though a good portion of his budget has been squandered on booze.

Use branzos for the head, feros for the guard. and chomne for the handle.

Name: Iktar's Story
Content: The story Lydia told you about Iktar sounds interesting. Why did this beloved knight suddenly become an exile? What is behind this story?

Name: The People's Militia
Content: Marco is discreetly working to arm part of the population in case the situation degenerates at the castle. He is looking for weapons that could be forged in a secret location.
Hint: Progress of this questline: {0}/{1}

Name: An attractive island
Content: You notice a small island on the Tarzakon River. You decide to go and see if you can find anything interesting there.
ResultConclusion: The island is ultimately very mundane. But, you find a small chest that must have belonged to adventurers who disappeared in the waves.

Name: The Creature of Impossible Speed
Content: As you arrive on the spot, you're horrified to see a lightning-fast scarecrow-like creature scampering through the fields. It would be impossible to catch it.
Introduction: A badly injured guild druid tells you that an incredibly fast creature has been attacking all the druids.
ResultConclusion: The moment you activate the column, the creature settles there as if it were a perch. Stationary, it looks almost like a real scarecrow. You should now be able to destroy it.

Name: A Crate Discovery?
Content: Who could have left this crate here? Is it a trap or easy loot? There's only one way to find out, or rather, three.

Name: On the Trail of the Necromancer
Content: Just before leaving the site, one of your party notices the traces of a bayard, a rare mount prized by rich nobles. While you remember seeing them in Valsonge's history books, you have no recollection of seeing anyone with this kind of horse in Kortombe. What will you do now?

Name: Panorama: Shield of Astrid
Content: This seems like a suitable place for you to use your Lantern to scan the region.

Name: A Special Mix
Content:
A farmer thinks that by mixing carouge with mortar, he will be able to construct a more resistant wall. 

It's a wacky theory but the only cost is time.

Name: Plant Receiver Molouno
Content: Molouno Goldan Need Plant. Experiment Luminomanger 434.

Name: Set of Blankets
Content: The militia needs blankets for their expeditions. Different materials are required for the different terrains of the region.

Name: The Origin of Nuertesilicios
Content: You are at the Marquee of the Claw trying to learn how to cross into the depths of Darkblade Marsh.
Introduction: You know that the followers of the Claw are familiar with the area surrounding Darkblade Marsh. You decide to go ask them a few questions.
ResultConclusion:
You end up learning about a secret passage under the mountain which opens into Longuard Pass.

Emilio and his gang seem surprised that you've never asked them how to get to the other side before.

Children of the Claw should ask more questions, apparently...

Name: Finn's Investigation
Content: Finn asks you to keep Sorka busy while he tries to find clues as to her real motives.

Name: Scenario test
Content:
Vix eirmod inimicus sententiae eu. No est partem omnesque similique, ad dicam scripta mei. Magna adhuc euripidis et sed, id vel viris laudem. Ei vix atqui vitae.

Ei dictas fierent ancillae sed, impedit detracto percipit in eum. Qui an volumus commune adolescens. Corrumpit scribentur vel et, te mea saepe soluta civibus. Ne vis congue alterum constituto, simul graecis id cum. Et erat erroribus est, per te choro iudico.
ResultIntroduction: Scenario Introduction
ResultConclusion: Scenario Conclusion

Name: Secret Service
Content: You're at the inn that the merchant Boldar frequents. You must deliver a message to him in secret.
Introduction: You must deliver a message to a merchant named Boldar in Gantras. They say he spends his nights at The Monster of Gargagoth.
ResultConclusion:
You blend in with the drunken patrons so that Boldar fails to notice you slipping the message onto his dessert plate.

You hang around for a while to ensure he doesn't eat the message then continue on your way.

Name: A Magnificent View
Content: Many travellers stop here to admire the panoramic views of the great river and cliff. Unfortunately those same admirers of nature throw trash everywhere. Is that the kind of problem you like to solve?

Name: The Spy Amongst the Sleeping
Content:
You are at the House of the Setting Sun to track down Ector's son's murderer. 

Undercover as an employee of Enchanfruits, hopefully you will have enough flowers to nurture for the entirety of your investigation.
Introduction: You need to return to the house to do your work while completing your investigation.
ResultConclusion:
You attempted to find Ector's assassin without much success.

You start to suspect that something is wrong. You notice that employees are watching you a little too closely.

You finish your work with the flowers and leave the premises before things go awry.

Name: Poisoned River
Content: Celeste Kortombe asked you to go to the Korllights Academy to help the researchers who are trying to combat the poison in the waters of the Thaumaturge. When you get there, you'll have to decide how best to make yourself useful.
ResultIntroduction: After explaining to Oblir that the burgomaster was sending you there for the latest on the toxin, he took you to the rooms where the students were testing.
ResultConclusion: Partly as a result of your efforts, a cure has been found. Unfortunately, academy researchers do not have all the ingredients to prepare the antidote. You still reported the research results to Celeste Kortombe. They thank you and confirm that they will need you to obtain the ingredients.

Name: Confront the Warlord
Content: The Scabonzi Warlord is now located. Killing him should end their invasion.
Introduction: Now is the time to face the warlord of these vermin.
ResultConclusion: Seeing you arrive at his cabin looking victorious, Ralouf becomes overjoyed and jumps into your arms. Despite his questionable personal hygiene, you give him a sincere hug. He then gives you the rest of his wealth as a reward. He doesn't need it anyway.

Name: Big Trouble in Little Enorwen
Content: Saraya has asked you to investigate a new group that has settled in Enorwen. It's against the Hippogriff's interest for the group to take over the place.
Introduction: Saraya has asked you to investigate a group that has recently settled in Enorwen.
ResultConclusion: Saraya seems satisfied with your report. She tells you to forget all about the story and take no further action in Enorwen at this time.

Name: Ruins of the Norkantas Portal
Content: You are standing in front of the ruins, looking for a way to activate the portal.

Name: Animal Control
Content: The authorities of Kortombe ask for the help of adventurers and hunters to reduce the population of wild animals in Ordval.
Hint: Progress of this questline: {0}/{1}

Name: The Scabonzi War Camp
Content: The phenomenal amount of half-eaten bits of cheese and rat droppings gives you a good idea of the nature of the impending threat: Scabonzislots of Scabonzis!
ResultConclusion: The last ratman has just let out his death rattle under the force of your blows. You congratulate yourself on having slowed the territorial expansion of these vermin. You raze their outpost and take their loot.

Name: Question Time
Content: You no longer have a choice, you will have to "question" some of the pirates patrolling the island to find their lair.
Introduction: It is time to find another way to locate the pirates' lair.
ResultConclusion:
Feeling harassed by your questioning, one of the pirates attempts to flee towards their lair. As he enters the forest, a flash of light blinds you.

The camp was hidden by magic!

Name: A strange delivery
Content: You're not sure, but this location seems to be near one of the locations where you have a delivery to make.

Name: The Garnet Ruin
Content: An ancient stretch of wall appears to have some precious stones entombed within. It will take some work to get them out.

Name: Harth's War
Content: The team responsible for the Ruins of the Cyclops have opened an ancient tomb. The druids need help to counter the onslaught of ghosts coming from within.
ResultConclusion: The druids tell you of the location of a vault where the creature responsible for corrupting these ruins dwells.

Name: Pay of the Celestial Tree
Content: You understand that the tree did not train you for nothing, there is a task that you must do for it.
ResultIntroduction: The Sylvan emissary informs you that the passage to Tarzakon is now open to you.

Name: Tribal Decorations
Content: Members of the Claw Assembly decorate everything they can with trophies from creatures that they have defeated. A good way to gain acceptance in the community is to provide some for the decoration of public spaces.
Hint: Progress of this questline: {0}/{1}

Name: The Collector's clothes
Content: The Collector requires a well-stocked wardrobe. Today, he is looking for these clothes.

Name: The Pirate Adventure
Content: Finally! A real pirate adventure! Are you capable of freeing Sahranna?

Name: Set in Stone
Content: The marbleworks is currently buying stone for a large project. The stone must be delivered in good condition, directly to the Marbleworks of the Elites.
Hint: Progress of this questline: {0}/{1}

Name: Debris on the Plateau
Content: You notice debris further down the cliff. Getting to it will not be simple.

Name: Sylph's Mixtures, Volume 2
Content: You work with Sylph to create a Sylphian mixture to help her against crystals corruption.

Name: Lost Travellers
Content: A group of brigands is in full discussion in a small clearing. They seem to be looking for a place where they hope they can find important treasures.

Name: The Forest Totem
Content: A totem representing tall trees and ancient animals has been built here.
ResultConclusion: You feel the energy of the High Huntress pervading you. You dream of a great hunt in a forest of ancestral trees.

Name: Shrewd Suspicions
Content: After arriving at the meeting place, you notice a young woman, probably Petunia, Mauves lover, talking with a hard-faced man covered in scars. Other hooded figures are preparing to surround her. It is time to make your next move.
Introduction: After listening to Mauve's instructions, you are ready to go to the meeting place.
ResultIntroduction: You arrived at The Camp of Last Chances, then you noticed that Petunia, the lover of Mauve, seemed to be on the verge of being surrounded by brigands. What hero wouldn't intervene?
ResultConclusion:
After saving Petunia from the ambush, you explained to her that her love had sent you for protection.

She thanked you by giving you a small reward then prepared to return to Kortombourg. She believes it would be wiser for you to do the same rather than stay put.

Name: Alcheran and the Alchemists
Content: You arrive at the science centre and bid farewell to the young alchemists before returning to Wynael for your reward.
Introduction: The three students pick up their rucksacks and start after you. You're left hoping that the road towards Alcheran will be free of dangerous encounters. The young alchemists will be of no use to you in combat.

Name: The Furthest Reaches of Kortombe
Content: A fellow Walker has decided that he will return to Myriaden only after climbing the mountain to the west. He gives you a gift before returning to his home.

Name: The whims of the Caravanserai
Content: Caravanners are proud of their caravans. Even here, at the top of Ridicule, people like to add a touch of prestige to their constructions.
Hint: This daily quest can be completed 25 times.

Name: Ilmagoth's Cry
Content: When you arrive at the tomb, you find that the ghastly place is all too quiet.
Introduction: You suspect that the cry might have come from Hordulk'hos Tomb. In his letter, Palenne warned Sally that waking Bobu could have consequences for the other dead in the tomb.
ResultConclusion: There is something moving in the tomb. You are sure of it.

Name: The Missing Rune
Content: Neither keys nor brute force will help here. The door seems impossible to open.
ResultIntroduction:
The door appears to be locked somehow. A quick glance around alerts you to the presence of several runes surrounding the door. However, one of them appears to be missing.

Leonidas is the man to help with a problem like this.

Name: Walking in the Water
Content: You see shards of glass on the other side of the waterfall. Crossing without being carried away by the current will not be an easy task.
ResultConclusion: You made it through! Coming back should be easier.

Name: Gnoll and Void
Content: A group of Caravaneers are in a heated argument with some Knights of the Rose. The Caravaneers hunt the gnoll of the area while the Protectors worry that taunting the gnolls may serve only to make them even more aggressive.

Name: An Amble in Arkzoun
Content: After arriving at your destination, Anismalia begins searching for her special root, but she has no immediate luck.
Introduction: The botanist Anismalia requires an escort to protect her from the dangers of the Arkzoun Mountains.
ResultConclusion:
You search for a while longer before coming across a group of Protectors of the Rose who volunteer to take charge of Anismalia for the remainder of her search. 

You will never know what exactly she was searching for or why she wanted it so badly.

Name: The Search of the Maranchons
Content: On the ground near the plinth, you discover a plaque upon which a message is written: "Between river and orange forest, on the edge of the approach."

Name: A distant corrupted memory, Volume 4
Content: The runes invoke a memory that you must face alone.

Name: Panorama: The Silent Plain
Content: This seems like a suitable place for you to use your Lantern to scan the region.

Name: Transport to Enorwen
Content: Before you're even at its doors, the cooks of the inn come out to welcome you. With some tasty looking refreshments, of course.
Introduction: You must deliver the cargo to Enorwen.

Name: Confused Historians
Content: Men and women in rich but torn and dirty clothes seem to be quarrelling in the centre of the clearing. When you arrive, the youngest of the group advances, dagger in hand, towards you.

Name: Harth's Finale
Content: The druids of the Circle eagerly await the day that a member of the guild destroys the terrible Harth.
Introduction: The druids have told you where the terrible Harth hides.
ResultConclusion: The druids hold a ceremony in which they give you a guild tabard. It is an honour normally reserved for higher-ranking members.

Name: Mystery of the Fairies
Content: You see what appears to be an ancient plinth which looks as if it could crumble in just a gentle breeze. Despite its fragile state, you sense a weak magical aura escaping from it. Investigating its surroundings may uncover some clues.

Name: The pirate treasure
Content: A ship with a black sail appears on the horizon and docks on the shores. Make the pirates understand that they are far from their island and are not welcome here.
ResultConclusion: Your great dexterity allows you to pick the lock without difficulty. Once the trunk is open, a smile of satisfaction crosses your face. All of that effort will have paid off in the end.

Name: Just a Man Atop a Mushroom
Content:
An older gentleman sits on top of the giant bolete mushroom. He looks like he's been up there for a while, and it's clear why. 

Some large, sinister spiders are waiting for him at the foot of the shroom.
ResultConclusion:
With the spiders gone, you can get close enough to chat with the previously trapped man.

He offers you potions to heal your wounds.

Name: Eyes of the Night
Content: Red lights flash amidst the distant trees of the forest. Unless you are completely silent, they disappear as you approach. Could these be fairies?
ResultConclusion:
You have successfully approached the light sources. Though to your puzzlement, these are not fairies after all but the reflection of the moon on painted tree trunks.

But who painted them?

Name: Bickering Merchants
Content:
A couple of merchants travelling back to Wellnear have stopped in their tracks to have a heated disagreement about a petty issue.

They're going to need help resolving it or they will be arguing here for all eternity.

Name: The fallen trees
Content: A few trees fell during a storm. Perhaps you will find some good construction wood there?

Name: The cursed fountain
Content: Arrived on the scene, you feel an energy of the mists in the surroundings, your lantern reacts to the approach of the fountain.
Introduction: You have decided to inspect the fountain pointed to by the dying Joktos.
ResultConclusion:
When the last creature finally falls, you turn back to the fountain to see if a second wave of creatures will come out.

Fortunately, everything now seems to be calm again.

Name: The Shining at the Overlook
Content: Something is shining a little further down the cliff. If only you had a way to reach it.

Name: A Lost Chest
Content: You have found a lost chest.

Name: Ruins of Corinna's Portal
Content: You're stood in front of the ancient ruins, wondering how you will activate the heavily damaged portal.

Name: Daddy's Long Legs
Content: Aeryn wants you to find him giant spider legs that could be used for more tavern decorations.
Introduction: Go to the Donpa Woodlands to find the giant spiders.

Name: Like a Bird in a Cage
Content: To your amazement, you see a young warrior trapped in a cage hanging from a tree.
Introduction: Having a good idea where Finn Vorel may be, you prepare to go looking for him.
ResultConclusion:
The young warrior's embarrassment at needing your help is written all over his blushing face. Though his pride does not stop him thanking you and presenting himself with cordial dignity.

You barely have time to exchange a few words before you're startled by grunts and cries of anger from the nearby bushes.

Name: Gremfyrs at Roic's Place
Content: One of the creature's young cubs clambers on top of the statue of Roic. It would be best to get it off before a fanatic of the former hero arrives to pay their respects.
ResultConclusion:
Under Roic's watchful gaze, you hand the little one over to his mother - maintaining eye contact with her throughout. She removes an artefact dangling from her cane and throws it to you.

This symbol of respect for the young of the world will follow you for the rest of your adventures.

Name: The Portal Network
Content: Leonidas asks you to find two portals. The first is south of the village of Larcen, near the Forest of Whispers. The second portal is north of Wellnear, between Pandolfo hill and the Fairy Forest.
ResultConclusion: Leonidas tells you where the Mistwalkers headquarters are located.

Name: Saving Gularzob
Content: You prepare to interrupt the mutanorks. Once you start, you won't be able to go back. Are you really ready?
ResultIntroduction: After the fight, you approach the king of the fortress. With his last breath, he points to the mural on the wall and says the word "Goldom."

Name: The Hidden Guardian
Content: You arrive at the ruins of what appears to be a tomb made up of several burial chambers. However, you don't immediately see anything of especial interest.
Introduction: You believe the energy flows lead here.
ResultConclusion:
You find a strange xuran stone. When you touch it, it moves and activates to form a door which opens into a new burial chamber.

Two terrifying icy-blue eyes are waiting for you in the shadows...

Name: Sylph's Mixtures, Volume 8
Content: You work with Sylph to create a Sylphian mixture to help her against crystals corruption.

Name: Creating the Remedy
Content: After helping the Korllights researchers, Celeste Kortombe asked you to recover the ingredients necessary to clean the river. How are you going to do it?
ResultConclusion: You bring the ingredients requested by the academicians and Celeste Kortombe. With the wings, they can finish the antidote. Celeste thanks you and believes that she will need you to find the source of the contamination and put an end to it.

Name: Axe Mastery
Content: Berthier offers to show you his old axe fighting tricks.
ResultConclusion:
You barely manage to survive Berthier's initial attack.

After a few minutes of combat, you end up understanding a little better how he uses his axe to destabilize you.

The experience, while unnerving, was most rewarding.

Name: The Ambush
Content:
The rumour of a noble lady in distress has been proven false. You could leave them to their misdeeds, but it would be a solution rather unworthy of an adventurer. You could also prepare for an armed confrontation, but it could end badly for you. Or you could do a little a dance, but that probably wouldn't improve your situation.

What do you want to do?
ResultConclusion: The brigands are now unconscious and tied up. It is time to decide what will happen to them.

Name: Cliff Study
Content: It is requested that all Arcanists able to enter Garrun'gol Cliff collect samples there for the analysis team.

Name: The Auto-Harpoon Launcher 300
Content: A ship belonging to one of the city's privateers has a machine capable of launching an assortment of spears. The authorities will therefore buy batches of sorontile spears for the bow, and spears of domane for the port and starboard sides.

Name: Work Gloves
Content: Ulrick asked you for some hare leather gloves for one of his lumberjacks. Gloves in this comfortable leather are the favourite of many lumberjacks.
ResultConclusion: The site workshop will not be functional for a while. Ulrick therefore created a bulletin board on which he writes what he needs for the site.

Name: Council of the Pitiful
Content: Badouk was not expecting to be denied access to the lord of Wellnear. He must be with you to complete this quest.
Introduction: In typical Badouk fashion, he suggests going to the nearest inn to mull over your next move. And have a drink or two, of course.

Name: A Lost Chest
Content: You have found a lost chest.

Name: The alchemical ritual
Content: In order to find where the totem came from, Rolonet must accomplish a ritual and is in need of an assistant.
Introduction: Rolonet gives you a list of ingredients and asks you to help him find them in the mess that is his laboratory.

Name: The Den
Content: A group comprised mostly of young peasants wishes to construct a den to protect themselves from the dangers of the forest. You could help.

Name: Victims of Fairies?
Content: As you arrive on the scene, you discover the missing workers enclosed in jet-black vines. Creatures resembling charred trees are stood behind them.
Introduction: You promised Alissia that you would check in on one of her groups of workers.
ResultConclusion: Before leaving, you collect the pieces of wood that can still be used. You have never before seen animated trees like that. You suspect this won't be the end of things.

Name: The Beds of the Setting Sun
Content: Jahiri has very special customers. To provide them with optimal comfort, each bed is made to measure.
Hint: Progress of this questline: {0}/{1}

Name: Stratram Terror II
Content: Even with the terror pushed back, the barrier doesn't deactivate. Disheartened, you decide to return to report to Morak.
Introduction: Even with the terror pushed back, the barrier doesn't deactivate. Disheartened, you decide to return to report to Morak.

Name: Marsh Hare
Content: The Rabouf family wishes to explore the Salamander Marshes. Chinvre and hare leather traveller's clothing is required for the expedition.

Name: Order in the Camp
Content: A group of hunters deserves a lesson in organisation. Who are you to not get involved?

Name: Of Trolls and Totems
Content: The trolls have stolen the totems from the warriors of Fearpiercing Camp. You promised Toride you would find them.
Introduction: The trolls probably brought the totems back to Minotroll.

Name: Port Delivery
Content:
Amidst the hustle and bustle of the port, a group of militiamen approaches you and demands your cargo, stating that it is property of the lord. 

You have no intentions of letting it go.
Introduction: Heriza asked you to go to the village port and deliver a shipment of alcohol to Forewoman Stoe.
ResultConclusion:
The group of militiamen eventually back off and leave, throwing a few curses over their shoulders as they go. You feel like you're in one of those novels where the hero arrives in town and immediately gets in trouble with the local thugs.

Who doesn't love the classics?

Name: Home Alone
Content: You arrive at what appears to be the outpost of a group of mercenaries. There is no one at the camp. You could take advantage of the situation.

Name: Ruins of Enorwen Portal
Content:
The portal is covered with a hop-like plant growing up from the ground. Given that the surrounding soil has been tilled, the plants are likely grown intentionally by the local farmers. 

You must rid the portal of these plants without alienating the farmers of Enorwen.

Name: Calista's Black Box
Content: Calista barely looks at you, merely pointing to a place for you to leave the box.
Introduction: Coming directly from Maliken, a package is to be delivered to Calista Tantillon at her woodland estate.
ResultConclusion: As you leave Calista's house, you hear her laughing like a witch. It's safe to say that this is worrying.

Name: Tainted Fields
Content: Celeste Kortombe asked you to meet with traders, farmers and citizens to better understand the problems affecting food production. It is up to you to decide the best way to learn more.
ResultConclusion: After telling her your observations, you notice that Celeste's pretty face has darkened. She does not add anything to your report and thanks you for your work.

Name: Another Formality
Content: Once again, you must get to grips with the formalities of Gantras laws.

Name: Materials for Grandflood
Content: The shipyard is looking for large quantities of wood and metal for the construction of ships.
Hint: Progress of this questline: {0}/{1}

Name: A Mistpiercer
