Content: You have found a Mistpiercer, a machine capable of sowing chaos if misused. To destroy it, you will need to first face its guardians.

Name: The challenge of the grown-ups
Content: The child of the Claw must be able to fight against the creatures that roam around them. The dice of destiny will choose who is the enemy of the day.
Hint: This daily quest can be completed 25 times.

Name: Citrine at the Summit
Content: You can make out the yellow glow of citrine crystals at the top of a huge rock. All that's left to do is to climb.

Name: Panorama: Tarkazon Hills
Content: This seems like a suitable place for you to use your Lantern to scan the region.

Name: An almost empty-handed return
Content: Arriving at the fort, Leonidas awaits your report.
Introduction: Finding nothing more interesting in the cave, you decide to return to report to Leonidas.

Name: The strong machines
Content: One of the old craft complex buildings is in dire need of new machinery. Craftsmen are needed to create more resistant machines.
Hint: This daily quest can be completed 25 times.

Name: Leafing so Soon?
Content: A strange pile of leaves seems to have been placed intentionally. Does it merit a little investigation?

Name: Party in the woods
Content: The sounds of songs and music guide you to a small clearing in which a party is being held, organized by young people from the neighbouring town. Some play music while others sing and dance. Some even compete in axe throwing. Beautiful pieces of meat are cooked on the spit and the aroma they give off makes your mouth water. You notice two barrels in the center of the scene in which young people will sometimes dip. One of them seems to contain herbs and the other mushrooms. They surely use these substances to get drunk. You would like to get your hands on such quantities in order to concoct potions and poisons.
ResultConclusion: You leave with an impressive amount of herbs and mushrooms.

Name: A distant corrupted memory, Volume 1
Content: The runes invoke a memory that you must face alone.

Name: Disgruntled Gremfyrs
Content:
Armed gremfyrs who had been hiding behind trees and thickets come out of their hiding places to attack you. 

Finn, grabbing a thick branch from the ground, fearlessly rushes the largest of them. Convinced that their leader will get the best of your new ally, the rest of the goblinoids turn to you.
ResultIntroduction:
You each fought off gremfyrs admirably and the rest of them fled through the trees in the face of your superiority. 

Finn was slightly injured during his fight, but there was no doubt about his victory. He thanks you once again for your help.

Name: Help for a Lumberjack
Content: When you arrive at your destination, you see Julien who is treating a sprained ankle. He explains to you that he was injured by falling into an old burrow, and that he does not feel strong enough to return to Kortombourg. He needs you to pick up logs for him. You will have to find some around his camp.
Introduction: After listening to Mylena's instructions, you prepare to go in search of Julien.
ResultConclusion: Julien confirms that he will stay a little longer in the wood to take care of his ankle. However, he asks you to inform Mylena of his situation so that she can reassure his wife.

Name: Fish for the Community
Content: A fish and seafood banquet is planned for the near future. Help the egrom by collecting fish along the shore.

Name: Tools for Grandflood
Content: The Grandflood Shipyard needs tools for the construction of Jon Thorval's new fleet.
Hint: Progress of this questline: {0}/{1}

Name: Tongue-tied
Content: Aeryn continues his quest for strange components by asking you to retrieve creature tongues that he could use to tie things together.
Introduction: You will find the strange little creatures in this swamp.

Name: The Plain of Lions
Content: By decree of Jon Thorval, a reward will be granted to all who assist in efforts to decrease the lion population around our great city.

Name: Looting the Trogulnus' Lair
Content: These beings, who normally live underground, are a threat to Kortombe. The lair must be destroyed.

Name: The Never Ending Plains
Content: A group of well-meaning citizens from Enorwen wish to set up a system of stone statues painted with arrows directing adventurers towards the main road. The challenge is knowing where to point the arrows.

Name: The Big Bad Vargrs
Content: Caroline Jussifrus explained to you that the Golden Gin has had recent problems with particularly vicious vargrs. It is up to you to determine the best way to resolve the situation.
ResultConclusion: Caroline thanks you for getting rid of the vargrs and gives you your reward.

Name: A Lost Chest
Content: You have found a lost chest.

Name: The Ruin of the Point
Content: A foul odor passes through your nostrils. You quickly realize that you have just found a corrupted ruin.

Name: Glacial Study
Content: It is requested that all Arcanists able to enter Garrun'gol Glacier collect samples there for the analysis team.

Name: Observation Platform
Content: What a view! However you notice that the foundation of the viewing platform is too fragile. Could you manage the repair work?

Name: A Lost Chest
Content: You have found a lost chest.

Name: Essence of Death
Content: Calista Tantillon explained to you that she needed vials of alcoholigron, a substance found only on the living dead in Malarcane Forest. You must find and defeat these foul creatures and bring back the ingredient.

Name: Sylph's Mixtures, Volume 5
Content: You work with Sylph to create a Sylphian mixture to help her against crystals corruption.

Name: The Dematis mine
ResultConclusion: You are sure, the conduit leads to one of the islands north of the mine. Now you just have to cross the cave to get there.

Name: Wellnear in Need
Content:
Every day, one struggling Wellnear family has the right to ask for an item of clothing that could see them through difficult times.

We hope that a noble artisan will choose to spend his day making the people of Wellnear happy today.
Hint: This quest will give you access to other quests depending on your number of successes. Progress of this questline: {0}/{1}

Name: Whims of Nobility
Content: Guloft, at Quarawood Furniture, needs a specific material for a piece of furniture intended for the nobility of Quara. Can you help him?
Hint: This quest can be done every day. It does not influence your reputation progress.

Name: Mystery of Pandolfo
Content: You see what appears to be an ancient plinth which looks as if it could crumble in just a gentle breeze. Despite its fragile state, you sense a weak magical aura escaping from it. Investigating its surroundings may uncover some clues.

Name: A Gift for Leonidas
Content: Upon your arrival at the Throne of the Troll, you greet Leonidas and give him the package that Mylena has entrusted to you.
Introduction: You prepare to leave in the direction of the Throne of the Troll to deliver the package to Leonidas.
ResultIntroduction: After thanking you, Leonidas admitted to having forgotten to give you important information concerning your possible return to Valsonge.

Name: The Two Dignitaries
Content: Two haughty dignitaries demand the same room at the Corinna Inn. You try to turn the situation in your favour while liberating Nallana from her distress.
ResultConclusion:
You've successfully taken the blame for displeasing the unfortunate guild, letting Nallana off the hook. And you can be sure that the favoured guild will remember you kindly.

After this, the dignitaries continue their way to Kortombe where they will certainly be talking about you.

Name: Grandpa Blonose's Headbands
Content: Grandpa Blonose, the old storyteller bard, wants headbands in all colours. He says every story deserves a headband and every headband has its story. Grandpa will take possession of the headbands during his visit to The Queen's Fianc.
ResultConclusion:
Grandpa Blonose takes the headbands and begins to tell a meandering story about an animated creature made of diantine living in the Archantic Range. The creature is said to be afraid of coloured hats.

At the end of the story, he pulls out a handful of diantine as if it proves the tale's truth. He offers it to you as payment for the headbands.

Name: Whack-a-Cylmo
Content: Cylmos are locked up on the floor below. To stop them from getting out, you'll have to knock them out with a special mace that's attached to the grate.
ResultConclusion: It was a lot of fun and, above all, plenty of training on the proper use of a mace. You block the gate and continue on your way, leaving behind a horde of stunned cylmos.

Name: The Caravan Courier
Content: While not unfriendly, the inhabitants of the Caravanserai are clearly suspicious of you. You will have to convince them that you come on behalf of Charles or find Kilounata yourself.
Introduction: You must find the Grandwind Caravanserai and deliver a message to Kilounata Mironddur.
ResultConclusion:
You eventually find Kilounata and deliver Charles's message to her. You realise that Kilounata must be highly respected by the other inhabitants as their attitude towards you immediately warms now that she has spoken to you.

An old woman comes up to you and hands you a headband that she has woven.

Name: Tarzakoniste Totem
Content: You have found one of the strange totems in the swamp.
ResultIntroduction: After activating the totem, a jet of light emanates from the structure's eyes and frames the large waterfall to the north of the swamp.

Name: A Distracted Botanist
Content: You meet a botanist who explains to you that she lost her bag in a crevice.

Name: The Path of the Caninbanes
Content: You look at the abandoned burrow and wonder what path the caninbanes might have taken for their attack on Ovie's pack.
ResultConclusion: You end up discovering a crack in the cave wall which sinks deep into the darkness.

Name: The Flying Academic
Content: A Korllights professor wants to make a flying machine and jump off the cliff. You can help him... not to do that.

Name: Explaining the Abandoned Burrow
Content: Your instincts lead you to believe that something is wrong here. It can't be coincidence that you were greeted by a lone cub on your first visit to the area.
Introduction: You now have everything you need to find the burrow. If you're struggling to explore the site, equip the serum.
ResultConclusion:
Your investigation leads you to believe that a creature has entered the burrow and slaughtered its inhabitants.

As you are about to leave the premises, a sound catches your attention...

Name: Sword Mastery
Content: Arnaud Feroscross has agreed to offer you bespoke sword training.
ResultConclusion:
With a sword in his hands, Arnaud is a very impressive sight indeed. You quickly realise that you were merely a nuisance to him.

Still, as he is a man of honour, he has provided you with comprehensive training and your understanding of sword combat has greatly improved.

Name: Forge Mastery
Content: You have agreed to make a special metal creation to decorate Rlne Kortombe's castle.

Name: Mace Mastery
Content: Florentina has agreed to provide you with mace training.
ResultConclusion:
Despite her armour and small stature, you're amazed at how well Florentina is able to wield her huge hammers and maces.

The secret seems to be to use the weapon's inertia to your advantage. You still have a lot to practice to progress to her level of prowess.

Name: The Origin of Insect Species
Content: You investigate at the port of Thorbourg in search of clues about the origin of the suckhops attacking the farms of the region. You will need a vigilant team to constantly survey the harbour.
ResultConclusion:
You have discovered that some time ago, a certain Vorf Lundgrof received a strange shipment from the Pringdan Hop Plantation.

The man is said to live near the desert, south of the city.

Name: Lantern Repair
Content: Leonidas asked you to bring him glass vials so that he could repair your Mist Lantern. You'll find them in the woodland near your current location.
Introduction: Leonidas asked you to bring him glass vials so that he can repair your Mist Lantern.
ResultConclusion:
You give the glass to Leonidas, then he disappears behind the throne while mumbling something about how you should wait there for a few minutes. 

A few minutes pass, then many more. Just when you prepare to go looking for Leonidas he returns, carrying your precious Lantern in hand.

Name: Improvements to the Fortress
Content: Fortress renovations require more materials than was originally planned for.

Name: Troubles in Lovers' Plain
Content: The purification team needs help in Lovers' Plain. Any guild member able to participate in combat is invited to join the struggle against a horrifying creature in the region's haunted ruin.

Name: Report to sergeant Carl
Content: Sergeant Carl awaits your report.
Introduction: Report to Sergeant Carl.
ResultConclusion: When you mention the trogulnus, Carl looks confused.

Name: Weapons for Alissia
Content: Alissia has asked you to craft weapons for her teams.

Name: Learning the Basics of Water Evocation
Content: Yolasula invites you to learn the basics of water evocation to continue dealing with the golem issue.

Name: A Dubious Incantation
Content:
Karina is in search of the following ingredients: Three funeral candles, two human bones, and three vials of strange water. She will also need the incantation book.

Rumour has it that these items might be found in the Lithofortress. A place well-renown for its dangers.

Name: The Gossiping Flower
Content:
After arriving in the woods, you searched for a while before finding the place described by Calista - a mysterious cave.

As you approach the cave entrance, something crunches underfoot and you hear a bloodcurdling screech coming from the darkness. Looking down, you see the crunch came from a gnawed-on bone, a human femur, that you stepped on. 

A creature resembling a huge gremfyr comes rushing out of the cave towards you. It is upon you before you have time to scream.
Introduction: The flower sought by Calista is found in a small cave in the Wood of Fables. It will surely be guarded. You should prepare well before going there.

Name: The Missing Sage
Content: Naovic has agreed to let you search for clues to Sahranna's disappearance. Either way, you can seek her out without his approval.
ResultConclusion:
It's safe to say that the inhabitants of this community are more colourful than most.

You end up learning that Sahranna is the cousin of Fabien at the Farm of the Excluded, and that she had to visit him for family reasons.

Name: A Mistpiercer
Content: You have found a Mistpiercer, a machine capable of sowing chaos if misused. To destroy it, you will need to first face its guardians.

Name: Back to Rhys
Content: After many adventures, you returned to the cemetery with the Grimkush oil. You just have to give it to Rhys Pair to receive your payment.
Introduction: You should go back to Kortombourg to complete the mission.

Name: Aggressive Goats
Content: Authorities in Kortombe want to reduce the goat population in the Crown Hills, as some travellers say they have been attacked.
Introduction: Authorities in Kortombe have established a headquarters in the hills to oversee operations.

Name: Gem Recipient Gildiro IV
Content: Gildiro Resonardo Need Resonance Experience Gems A354 Version 9.4 Post Regulation.
Hint: This daily quest can be completed 25 times.

Name: Reporting to Harmony Camp
Content: As a result of your efforts to counter the scabonzi threat, you report to Theosos to learn more about these creatures.
Introduction: Go to Harmony Camp to report to Theosos.

Name: The Perfect Camp
Content:
Ameliana is proud of her hard-earned knowledge, but she is also very demanding. 

The work you do with her is not easy, not least because you have to endure long boastful explanations of her family's achievements and accolades.

Name: Sewing Mastery
Content: You agreed to create a decorative tablecloth for Plindor because he's not on good terms with Carl Sifer. In fact, Plindor is not on good terms with anyone.
ResultConclusion:
Trank delicately takes the tablecloth and carries it to the main mansion of the farm.

He returns with your reward, informing you that Plindor is delighted with the result.

Name: Leonidas's Theory
Content: Having arrived at a place where you have a good view of all the surroundings, you put Leonidas's plan into action.
Introduction: Leonidas suggests that you search for Dar'hon's Perch using your Mist Lantern.
ResultConclusion:
The shards burn away and a shockwave ripples through the valley, dissipating the veil you noticed through your Lantern.

Leonidas was right, the perch should have been visible to everyone, even from the bottom of the mountain.

Name: The Pensioner and the Teenager
Content: An old lady is harassed by a young peasant, or it is the other away around? Since you have nothing else to do, you could put an end to whatever is occurring.

Name: A Call for Help
Content: It's loud now, you must be near where the calls are coming from. You're ready to open the package given to you by Leonidas.
Introduction: Leonidas has given you a package that you will need to open upon finding the source of the distress call. You must first go to Trolgobeth.
ResultConclusion:
An explorer's serum? It says on the label that if you're having trouble finding a place, partaking in this serum can help.

What a strange product.

Name: A Collapsed Vault
Content: To progress further, you will have to repair the place with new materials.

Name: The Helper Druid
Content: Try to convince Rakham to send a druid to help Ralouf with his ritual.
Introduction: Go ask Rakham at the Sanctuary of Eternity for the assistance of a druid for the time of a ritual.

Name: Lumberjack Camp Study
Content: Berthier's installations are far from the prettiest things you've ever seen, but their solidity more than compensates for their aesthetics. You undertake the task of learning more about their sturdy construction.

Name: Ruins of the Portal of Illusions
Content: You are standing in front of the ruins, looking for a way to activate the portal.

Name: The beds of the Order
Content: You end up understanding that the beds requested by Jahiri are used for controlling or spying on the residents. He therefore has no choice but to have them made by a craftsman of the Order.
Hint: This daily quest can be completed 25 times.

Name: Highland Hunting
Content: The scouts request aid in their fight against the creatures of the mountains. Do you have what it takes to help them this day?
Hint: This quest can be done every day. It does not influence your reputation progress.

Name: Daily Mine Order
Content: By decree of the duchy and on the recommendation of the supreme wisdom of the Duke of Gantras, the authorities authorize the following exchange for the needs of the mine and the betterment of the realm. Rewards will be based on the availability of materials.
Hint: This daily quest has no success limit.

Name: The Nauseating Well
Content: You look around with a growing sense of despair. The creatures of this tomb are far too dangerous for Sally. She will surely die if you don't convince her to turn back.
Introduction: You must explore Hordulk'hos Tomb and find a well there where a creature named Bobu resides.
ResultConclusion:
Tears in her eyes, Sally looks around at the hellish creatures and finally agrees to turn back.

Sally shouts instructions to you on how to open the tomb door yourself. She then casts a spell of light and starts sprinting towards the exit to attract the monsters away from you.

Name: A Classic Case of the Infamous Boot in the Mud
Content: It finally happened. Your boot got stuck in the mud and now you have to get it out. Did you seriously think that youd live a life of adventures without having to deal with this situation?
ResultConclusion: How fortunate! At the bottom of the hole left by your boot, a shiny object catches your attention.

Name: Destination Leviathan
Content: Like a portal of Mist, the entrance to Ridiathan is protected by powerful magic. You need to follow the steps cited by Leighanna to pave the way.
Introduction: You head to the place indicated by Leighanna to find the famous passage to the plateau of Leviathan.
ResultConclusion:
After all these adventures, the entrance to the cave opens before you with a monotonous creak.

You expected a more spectacular effect, but the result is there.

Name: The Howling Rose
Content: Scouts have reported a pack of vargr worgen that have moved a little too close to the Fortress of the Rose. A reward is promised to any adventurer who scares them away.

Name: Object of the Ancient Times
Content: After a tiring hike, you finally arrive in sight of the fort. Just as you afford yourself a second to relax, a group of hooded assailants springs a sudden ambush. You have no choice but to defend yourself.
Introduction: You must deliver an artefact to Leonidas. Then talk to him about a certain Badouk Brank.
ResultConclusion:
Once the fighting subsides, you turn to find the artefact has vanished. You search the bodies for clues, determined to discover the identities of the attackers.

There are no initials nor heraldic symbols to be found. Nothing that would help identify them. Only one thing is certain, they were not here by chance. They were waiting for you.

Name: Pyram Purification
Content: The number of creatures linked to the fire element must be reduced in the caverns.

Name: Fancy charcoal
Content: The Blast Furnace has a constant need for wood for the creation of coal. The use of coal of rarer essence makes it possible to carry out difficult projects.
Hint: This daily quest can be completed 25 times.

Name: A prisoner?
Content: You try to figure out who the creature is and why it is in this room.
ResultConclusion:
Eventually you figure out how to make contact with the creature. You place your fingers on the correct runes and then bond with the crystal creature.

After a while, your mind is bombarded with images of a magnificent construction made entirely of crystals.

Name: Tarul's ally
Content: Arrived on the spot, you notice that the door has been broken down. There is obviously no one in the room and the furniture appears to have been searched.
Introduction: Tarul asks you to join his ally at Diadem Manor. She should expect you in room fourteen.
ResultConclusion: You decide it would be better for Leighanna not to come back here. You leave the place, hoping not to have attracted too much attention.

Name: Transport Pass of Spirits
Content:
As you arrive on the scene, you find a group of Arcanists discussing the ores buried in the local bedrock. 

As soon as they see the crate you're bringing to them, their eyes light up with excitement.
Introduction: If you have understood the gibberish on the bulletin board correctly, you must deliver a crate of materials to the Pass of Spirits in Kortombe.
ResultConclusion: You leave the Arcanists to their experiments, knowing full well that there is a good chance that the mountain will explode in the next few hours.

Name: Ralouf's delivery
Content: Ralouf patiently awaits his delivery of new ritualist equipment.
Introduction: you must now return the equipment needed for the ritual to Ralouf.

Name: Investigation at Watchman Mountain
Content: Before you lie several skeletons of men and women. It's time to investigate.
Introduction: The skeletons were reportedly seen at the foot of Mount Faras.
ResultConclusion: The clothes of the corpses show that they were part of the Gantras militia. It seems they were ambushed. A little further, you discover a trogulnus skeleton. You should report to Sergeant Carl.

Name: King of the Rails
Content: Mining trolls have decided that the rail cart is theirs. If you wish to approach, you're going to have to prove you're the true owner of the rails.

Name: The Out-of-Order Automatons
Content:
A large cable car travels the river using a giant mechanism. This machine is powered by mechanical humanoids. Unfortunately, said mechanical humanoids appear to be malfunctioning, they are wandering around and acting most bizarrely.

You will have to find a way to restore them to operational condition.
ResultConclusion: Once overcome by your spells and technical expertise, the automatons reset and return to their posts. The mechanical cable car can now be used.

Name: Ritousan Portal Ruins
Content: The Ritousan Portal is in very poor condition. Activating it will be a major challenge.

Name: The Ruins of Kortombe Portal
Content: The Kortombe Portal is in good condition. You won't have to improve its structure, but it will be necessary to use your knowledge to properly calibrate the telluric resonance of the stones.
Introduction: Mylena hands you Leonidas's note indicating the place you should visit.

Name: A New Cylmos Nest
Introduction: Cylmos have built a nest so that they can begin inhabiting the area for generations to come. Ridding the region of the nest would be in the interests of Gantras's security.

Name: Creeping Death
Content: Sorka asks you to visit the wooded area of the Living Wall overnight to defeat the walking dead. Seems that a necromancer would like to know how they move in the forest.
Introduction: Sorka asks you to visit the wooded area of the Living Wall overnight to defeat the walking dead.

Name: Mecablip?
Content: Peculiar haywire golems assemble and activate on their own from the ancient debris that litters the cave's depths. Clearly malfunctioning, they act in all sorts of deranged manners. You are attempting to figure out just what's going on.
ResultConclusion:
It's your belief that the cave must have been shrouded in the Mists until very recently. Its original purpose must have been a dumping ground for the ancestral factory of Karal Ouloubek.

You can't yet be sure if the creatures of the Mists activated the golems, or if Ouloubek's magic was so powerful that it still persists after all this time.

One thing is certain, you will have to tell Leonidas about the cave as soon as possible.

Name: Celestial Labyrinth
Content: The woods prevent you, probably thanks to very ancient magic, from reaching the celestial tree. This is despite the fact that the giant tree is visible from all surroundings.
ResultIntroduction: You feel that a path opens in the forest and before you appears, in all its splendor, the celestial tree.
Hint: When you have possible solutions, options will be offered to you.

Name: Meat of the Savage Boar
Content: Quara's Hydra Inn needs savage boar to serve high-end food to their most distinguished customers.
Introduction: Savage boars live in the Quarazza Marsh.

Name: The Search of the Fairies
Content: On the ground near the plinth, you discover a plaque upon which a message is written:  "Overlooking one of the four, I only hear the echo of waves resonating with the fall."

Name: Fallen Fowl of a Leprechaun
Content: A group of most peculiar adventurers are gathered in the clearing, flapping their arms, and pecking at the ground. It appears they must be under some foul, or fowl, spell that has convinced them that they are birds. They must be helped before they launch themselves from the cliff.

Name: The Taming of the Tortolion
Content: To connect with and tame the tortolion, you are trying to break through its emotional shell.
ResultConclusion: The tortolion nuzzles you, seemingly understanding the importance of the gift you have just bestowed upon it.
Hint: This creature can reach level 40 and requires a solidity 45 cage.

Name: The Life of the Klotoss
Content: You realise that completing the mission will require a visit to Klotoss and return with proof that they are not a threat.
Introduction: You will need to go to the outpost to learn more about this story.
ResultConclusion: You can't be sure that all will work out well for the Klotoss, but your intervention should protect the resident of the House of the Setting Sun from any accusations.

Name: The Meeting Place
Content: The compromising letter mentioned a meeting place. Go there to search for more clues about the situation.
Introduction: You should inspect the meeting location mentioned in the letter.
ResultIntroduction:
The meeting seems to have already ended. But you notice footprints on the ground, heading east.

You look to the distance, and see the signs of a small encampment.

Name: The scary house
Content: Under the gaze of the gargoyles you approach the house. How will you get in?

Name: Location of the Fortified Castle
Content: Matis tells you the location of the fortified castle which probably belongs to the scabonzis. It would be wise for you to go and explore the place more closely.

Name: The decimated caravan
Content: Caravaneers have probably come across a group of Lazeris Goats. Their cart was cut into pieces. There may still be something of interest in the remains.

Name: Ruminating on Runes
Content: As you approach Leonidas, you ponder how best to describe the runes and the portal. The old man looks at you patiently while awaiting your question.
Introduction: The missing rune may be the "key" to unlocking the door. It would be wise to return to Leonidas to ask his opinion.

Name: The exchange of minoris attachments
Content: Gunya Karaken always needs a large amount of simple attachments for her students. She therefore organizes exchanges of minoris towards attachments of better quality.
Hint: This daily scenario is for your companions' enchantments.

Name: Dammed Fish
Content: Large rocks have fallen from a cart, blocking the stream below. This accidental dam threatens the ecosystem and lives of the fish population. You must save them!

Name: Myrtille Kombat
Content: By training with Myrtille, you have the opportunity to test your fighting skills.

Name: Laidor Spears for Plindor
Content: For reasons that do not concern you, the owner of the Plindor Farm is looking to acquire a bundle of spears.
Introduction: The Plindor Estate is located east of Aranbourg.

Name: Sorka's secrets
Content: You try to convince Sorka to say a little more in case her quest is linked to yours.

Name: Mountain Expedition
Content: You have agreed to help Ulrick prepare his expedition. You remain attentive to the folks around you to learn more about life outside the Mists.
ResultConclusion: You have finally completed the various tasks requested by Ulrick. He has rewarded you generously with objects that you have worked on.

Name: The luxury projects
Content: The marble factory is currently buying stones for a project. The stones must be delivered in good condition directly to the marble works.
Hint: This weekly quest can be completed 10 times.

Name: Good Neighbours
Content: Since you wanted to learn more about the neighbouring seigneuries and lordships, Oblir Lightmind suggested that you go to the relay station to listen to the rumours. It's up to you to decide how best to go about it.
Introduction: Oblir uses your map to explain the location of the relay station, then you prepare for your trip.
ResultIntroduction: To get to the relay station, you had to travel almost a third of the seigneury. During your trip, you admired fields of wheat, potatoes and lavender crops. Halfway, you noticed an old abandoned cart recently visited by wild animals and looters. An unknown odour seemed strange to you, but you did not see anything extraordinary. After spending a few minutes searching the place, you continued on your way.
ResultConclusion: You promise to tell Oblir what you learn at the relay station, then set off on new adventures.

Name: Channelizers from Myriaden
Content: You need to learn more about the channelizers Yolasula talks about. They might help you understand the magic outside of the Mists.
ResultConclusion:
At the end of your discussion, Yolasula hands you an old grimoire that she had on her desk.

She explains to you that this apprentice's spellbook should be suitable for minor spells.

Name: Mily's Whims
Content: Mily promised to help you build a better cage. But it won't be free.

Name: Ruins of Gantras Portal
Content: You stand in front of the impressive ruins, searching for a way to reactivate the portal.

Name: Carts and Cartography
Content:
You have followed the western road indicated by Umphric until you come across a cart mired deeply in the mud. 

Pacing back and forth next to it, muttering to himself, and occasionally pulling on his hair is a man wearing luxurious clothes caked in brown mud. 

The man seems to be on the verge of a nervous breakdown so you decide it's wise to gently alert him of your approach.
Introduction: Umphric showed you a location on your map where he suspects the cart should be. You are now ready to go on an adventure.

Name: Entering the Fort
Content: Leonidas had warned you that you would have to walk through a Mist Barrier to get to Mistwalker headquarters.
Introduction: Before disappearing, Leonidas showed you the location of Mistwalkers' Fort.

Name: Between Marshes and Mountains
Content: With dangers on either side, the terrain here is especially difficult to cross.

Name: The Dyeing Dregs
Content: Arrived near your destination, you hear a terrible buzz coming from Mount Cybelfly.
Introduction: You must transport the cargo of dregs to a warehouse behind the dyehouse.
ResultConclusion: The dyehouse workers hurry to get the cargo into their warehouse before more critters are attracted by the smell of the spent grains.

Name: A Mistpiercer
Content: You have found a Mistpiercer, a machine capable of sowing chaos if misused. To destroy it, you will need to first face its guardians.

Name: Wood Golems
Content: Defeat the golems using the fire evocation you have learned.
Introduction: The wood golems have moved northwards.
ResultConclusion: You have successfully defeated the wood golem! Return to Yolasula.

Name: A Dangerous Escarpment
Content: Your group arrives at a precipitous place where you have to be extra careful. Another group of travellers already appears to be in peril.

Name: The Return of the Herbarium
Content: You must bring the materials to Ouab at the big red mushroom.
Introduction: You must bring the materials to Ouab at the big red mushroom.
ResultConclusion:
Looking at the remains of his old herbarium, Ouab decides that it would be better to burn everything you brought back and start fresh.

Ignoring your frustration, Ouab begins talking in detail about what makes a good herbarium. 

You spend the day around the fire burning the materials you had put so much effort into retrieving. As you do so, you finally have a serious discussion with Ouab about herbalism and its secrets.

You should now be able to build a herbarium in your domain.

Name: Rhumeo and Jolieve
Content:
Jahiri would like a report on the situation of the chieftains in both places. 

Find out if the star-crossed lovers' story is still pertinent to the relationship between the clans. 

He has set up an informant for you halfway between the two clans to report back to.
Introduction: You must meet an informant in the plain between the two sites.
ResultConclusion:
According to your research, the story of the two lovers was quickly forgotten. Only a few old people still talk about it.

This story will certainly not become a classic studied by school children for centuries.

Name: The Catastrophic Detour
Content: A merchant tried to be clever by avoiding what he thought were robbers on the road. He quickly became trapped in the forest with his cart, facing far more dire straights than a few highwaymen.

Name: A Lost Chest
Content: You have found a lost chest.

Name: Gnolls on the Mountain
Content: Howling bloodthirsty screams are heard from a mountain ledge. There's not a moment to lose! The ambush of the sand gnolls is upon you!
Introduction: Lily told you that the problematic gnolls are settled in this part of the mountain.
ResultConclusion:
You prepare for another wave of gnolls by moving away from the mountain, out of range of their bombs.

Farther east you see clouds of dust and hear the characteristic cries of the gnolls. Either you scared them away or something else caught their attention.

Name: The Great Fear
Content: You have reached the other side of the passage!
Introduction: Emilio warns you that the passage is haunted by the ancient spirit of long-dead warriors. In order to pass through, you will first have to pass their tests.
ResultConclusion: You take a brief moment to ponder the fighting techniques of the Claw ancients.

Name: Hydram Terror
Content: The ice creature fixes you in its crystalline stare, waiting to see if you'll approach.
Introduction: Thanks to the reduction in the number of creatures from the Elemental Plane of Hydram, the Arcanists were able to advance closer to the ice barrier. There they discovered a most-troubling creature that now protects the barrier. Getting rid of it is of utmost priority for the guild.

Name: Stoe's Dream Warehouse
Content: You have agreed to become a supplier for the Stoe Warehouse Project. Stay in communication with Forewoman Stoe to discover which materials are needed to construct the impressive building.
ResultConclusion:
The warehouse is complete! You finally take your promised educational warehouse tour. 

The building is highly impressive and you're confident you can now build a scale model in your domain.

If you ever have a guild, you'll be able to build a bigger one, even bigger than Stoe's. But that's an adventure for another time.

Name: Sylph's Mixtures, Volume 7
Content: You work with Sylph to create a Sylphian mixture to help her against crystals corruption.

Name: Mystery of the Crucible
Content: You see what appears to be an ancient plinth which looks as if it could crumble in just a gentle breeze. Despite its fragile state, you sense a weak magical aura escaping from it. Investigating its surroundings may uncover some clues.

Name: Urban delivery
Content: You have found an address that matches one of your small packages.

Name: Relay Study
Content: You could learn valuable information about what makes a building optimal for accommodation. However, Ichalle will not share her expertise for free.

Name: Mist Technologies
Content: You think it would be possible to create directoflux columns for Tristan's project.
ResultConclusion:
It is with a little anxiety that you ask Tristan to turn on the lighthouse.

To your surprise, two intense light rays shoot north and south.

That of the north hits the cliffs of Cybelfly and causes a major rockfall of scree. You look towards Enorwen, relieved not to have pointed your powerful light columns in its direction.

Name: Sylph's Mixtures, Volume 9
Content: You work with Sylph to create a Sylphian mixture to help her against crystals corruption.

Name: A Box from Ages Past
Content: A strange box has arrived and should be delivered to Rhavina in Raven Marsh.
ResultConclusion: Rhavina thanks you for the mysterious delivery. However, she didn't seem willing to open the box in your presence, so you're left to wonder what was inside.

Name: Beautifying the Caravanserai
Content: Friends and guild members are being asked to contribute materials for the creation of a new Hall of Stories, where adventurers from all over the world can come and recount their exploits.
Hint: Progress of this questline: {0}/{1}

Name: The end of the passage
Content: The passage ends here and you don't see anything around.
ResultConclusion: You came here for nothing.

Name: Pestles and Mortars
Content: Ouab has asked you to create a series of herbalists' tools. These exercises are supposed to help you understand the principle work of the herbalist.
ResultConclusion:
Ouab takes a look at your tools, which you layout upon the roof of the mushroom. He is clearly very impressed with your crafting skills.

A sudden gust of wind catches the mushroom which then sways in the wind. Your tools are knocked to the ground and shattered into a thousand pieces.

Name: The Alcohols of Vorax at Thorax
Content: Ardent is constantly looking for exciting flavours to add to the distillery's alcohol. Return to him every day to discover the flavours he would like to test out.
Hint: Progress of this questline: {0}/{1}

Name: A scree
Content: You arrive at the site of a scree. It's always interesting to see if something of value is there.

Name: Issaya's pride
Content: Issaya's engineers are looking for high quality materials for the construction of a ship with the cooperation of the universities of Strata Obska.
Hint: This weekly quest can be completed 10 times.

Name: The Sleeping Totems
Content: Strange totems have been erected near the cliff. The symbols engraved on the stones are particularly complex. Will you take the time to study them?
ResultConclusion: While studying one of the totems, it collapsed. But you were very careful, deciding to remove all traces of your intervention.

Name: Milane's Latest Request
Content: On the construction site, Milane always needs a little something. Can you meet her needs today?
Hint: This quest can be done every day. It does not influence your reputation progress.

Name: Miblosa's Feet
Content: Zally's family uses many types of shoe in their work with sheep. A situation which isn't aided by the sheep's tendency to chew through leather. Can you provide them with the right shoes today?
Hint: This quest can be done every day. It does not influence your reputation progress.

Name: A Magnificent Delta
Content: So you didn't walk by the waterside just for the view. A boat has run aground at the entrance to the river. Its half-destroyed wreckage could hold something interesting, but what?

Name: The Final Assault on the Fortified Castle
Content: Now that the scabonzi forces are weakened, all that remains to do is to launch the final assault.
Introduction: The scabonzis' fortified castle is located in Smallfall Woods

Name: The Rune Key
Content: Now is the time to check if Rhavina's rune is working as expected. You take it out of your bag and walk towards the door.
Introduction: Return to the Lithofortress to use Rhavina's rune and unlock the door.
ResultIntroduction:
The magical lock on the door dissipates in front of your eyes. 

You can now move on.

Name: Unheroic Trash
Content: As Leonidas told you, explorers left streaked vials behind them. Now you just have to find enough to allow him to repair your Lantern.
Introduction: Leonidas asked you to bring him vials so that he can use them to repair your Lantern. You'll find them in the woodland near your current location.
ResultConclusion: You traversed through the forest for some time in search of vials. You finally find enough glass to allow Leonidas to help you. It's time to return to see him.

Name: The Brigand in the Trap
Content: A brigand caught his foot in his own trap. You could laugh at him and leave him to his fate or attempt to profit from the situation.

Name: Dead Season
Content:
Having reached your destination, you see the warnings you received were not nearly severe enough. In the daytime, the carnivorous griffotulan plants are ferocious. One wrong move could lead to a fatal botanic bite. 

Only those with a death-wish would dare to venture close to them at any time other than darkest night, when they are decidedly more subdued.
Introduction: Wynael has indicated a location to the northwest of Kortombe. This is where you must go at night to pick the griffotulan seeds.
ResultConclusion: You have successfully retrieved the seeds requested by Wynael. You put them in a small purse given to you by the alchemist for your mission. She will undoubtedly reward you when you return to Alcheran. You can therefore consider the transaction concluded.

Name: Improvement of the Caravanserai
Content: Friends and guild members are asked to provide materials for building upgrades. Residents will reward you with items of their creation.
Hint: Progress of this questline: {0}/{1}

Name: Rituals of the Somberseason
Content: You must travel through the province of Ordval and practice the Ritual of the Somberseason on sentient plants that have just died.
ResultConclusion:
You've just completed all the rituals available for the Somberseason. Maratatinus takes the life pearls and places them in a large chest made of Orus.

All you have left to do is disguise yourself in the image of the dead and go drink in an inn.

Hail the Somberseason!

Name: The guardian statues
Content: Stone statues stand tall and gaze toward the mists hiding the battlefield of Mount Silodan. As if the ancients wanted to protect Tarzakon from the creatures of the mists.
ResultIntroduction: You understand that your lantern has activated the defense mechanism!

Name: The Awakening
Content:
The shock of your arrival in this new place is passing. However, you feel drained of energy. Its like youve been robbed of part of your very being. 

You notice, with horror, that your Mist Lantern is no longer with you. Desperately searching in all directions, your eyes are drawn towards a vargr cub, carefree and vigorous, playing with the Lantern in the grass. You have no idea what will happen if he breaks the glass surrounding the Orb, but you don't intend to find out. What will you do?
ResultConclusion:
Following your initial relief at having retrieved your Mist Lantern, you now notice it has been cracked. You will be unlikely to use the Fog Orb inside right now. 

To make matters worse, the portal that you apparently travelled through appears to be out of order. You will have to find a solution. 

For reasons that are difficult to understand, the mystical link between you and the Orb is compelling you towards a specific, nearby point. Somehow, like an inner guide is beckoning, you feel you know where you need to go.

Name: The Quest for Knowledge
Content: Oblir Lightmind requires the writings of Leonel Marche to complete a book on the legendary hero, Roic the Incorruptible. You should help him in his research. How you do so is up to you.
ResultConclusion:
Oblir Lightmind looks at your findings and appears to be deeply satisfied. He thanks you profusely while explaining that Roic "the Incorruptible" Cesseness was an important hero during the transformation of the free lands of Karlinin into the seigneury of Kortombe. 

According to legend, he faced many bellicose knights and always came to the defence of the most disadvantaged. Oblir points out that there is a sanctuary dedicated to Roic on the other side of the Thaumaturge River.

Name: A Lost Chest
Content: You have found a lost chest. However, it is guarded by a creature. You will need to fight it first.

Name: (reuse 3)
Content: (reuse 3)

Name: [d] test de qute
Content: [d] test

Name: The Larcen Bed Commission
Content: Blanche is waiting for her new bed. You could see that she sleeps badly. You have to go to Larcen, find the bedmaker, and buy a bed that she will buy back from you.
Introduction: Blanche asked you to find Quarawood Furniture in Larcen and bring back a bed on your cart. Stay on the main road so you don't get lost!

Name: Elimination: white vargrs
Content: The white vargr population in the area is too high. This could endanger our hunters and travelers. If anyone is willing to reduce their number, they will be rewarded.
Introduction: The white vargr population is too high. You will find some at the foot of Watchman Mountain and at the Mountain of Illusions.

Name: Investigating the Collector
Content: You try to convince Mystil to tell you more about the Collector. She tells you that the Collector will only invite you if you have something to interest him.
Introduction: Your only lead to the Collector is Mystil. You'll have to convince her to say more.
ResultConclusion:
Mystil informs you that the Collector has agreed to meet you in one of his residences in Ordval.

This residence is hidden in the Eternity Woodlands in Tarzakon Valley.

Name: Nuances of Thorax
Content: Ardent is keen to further advance his search for nuanced savoury flavours for his alcohols. Perhaps you would enjoy helping him with his tests?
Hint: Progress of this questline: {0}/{1}

Name: The Riddle of the Thaumaturge
Content: You notice a group of people near the river.
Introduction: Following Deidre's instructions, you head for the riverbank, taking care not to be seen by the group you are pursuing.
ResultConclusion:
For a brief moment, a map of the forest appears above the water. A fox's head marks a particular place.

The gems and the riddle then disappear, which confirms that Hilla will not be able to follow you.

Name: Panorama: Cirkau Plateau
Content: This seems like a suitable place for you to use your Lantern to scan the region.

Name: To a Caravan's Aid
Content: You catch up with the caravan and discover that they are in bad shape indeed. You will have to help them so that they can cross the perilous region.
Introduction: Athuso tells you where the caravan was when he received their last message.
ResultConclusion: You watch the caravan move away towards the Hammery Plain, wondering how many more caravans you will need to save on your adventures.

Name: Strange Scree
Content: An epic fight looks to have taken place on the mountain. One of the combatant's spells caused part of the cliff to collapse.

Name: Peace for Rofuran
Content: Rofuran Delsun, the night watchman, wishes there were fewer wild creatures around. It would help him in his work. Do you think you can help him?
Hint: This quest can be done every day. It does not influence your reputation progress.

Name: Potential help
Content: Crossing the forest seems impossible at the moment. However, you can see a silhouette in the distance who seems busy collecting wood. If you approach, you may ask her for help, hoping that she will not be hostile.

Name: Garden Studies
Content: The Gris Domain is the best place to learn how to operate a garden outside of the Mists.

Name: The Ancestral Hypothesis
Content: After listening to the Baroness of Kortombe's worries concerning rumours about her ancestors, you decide to help her. After all, by educating yourself on the subject, you may find a way to deal with the problems plaguing the region. You must now decide on the next step.
ResultConclusion:
Back at the manor, you explain to the baroness that many citizens have the impression that everything comes from the death of Annabelle Kortombe who was allegedly poisoned by her son Reinfort. 

Baroness Relene Kortombe finds this idea ridiculous, but understands that the rumour will not die by itself. She believes that it is time to intervene to calm the spirits.

Name: Army of the Dreamer
Content: You inform the tree that a cult-like military camp is set up in Holdori. Even though their motives are unclear, they are clearly preparing for a significant event that may take place soon.

Name: "Where's Ouab?"
Content: Leovia is impatiently awaiting news from her uncle Ouab. He was last seen on the road to the Donpa Woodlands.
Introduction: The professor was last seen on the road to the Donpa Woodlands.
ResultConclusion: Leovia thanks you for saving her uncle.

Name: Making Books Talk
Content: When you arrive in Korllights, Oblir does not seem particularly interested in your quest, he instead directs you towards the library where you will have to conduct the research yourself.
Introduction: Rakham asks you to search Korllights for clues about the past of the ruins of Hammery Plain.
ResultConclusion: Your research was not as successful as you would have liked. The only finding of note was Valdiss the Terrible's manor, which is said to have disappeared during earthquakes in the troubled times 300 years before the Treaty of Maliken.

Name: Catoblepas hunting
Content: Fah' Poki awaits your return near her hut.
Introduction: Fah' Poki challenged you to defeat a forest catoblepas

Name: A Lost Chest
Content: You have found a lost chest.

Name: Block the tunnel, again
Content: You are back at the tunnel. Looking at it, you get an idea. Instead of blocking it, you should make it collapse. There are probably explosives near here.
Introduction: Your wall didn't hold back the tortolions for long. You're going to have to build another one.
ResultConclusion: After placing the explosives and lighting the fuse, you hide behind a large rock. You hear a loud BOOM and when you turn around, the tunnel is nothing but a pile of debris.

Name: Vile Vials
Content: Collect 10 vials of green poison for Aeryn's special project.
Introduction: You will find the poison inside the spiders in the Woodlands of the Dryads.

Name: Night of the Living Scabonzis
Content: You try to prove to Tara that the creatures of the forest are not undead.
ResultConclusion: With all those scabonzi corpses now littering the forest, you really hope a necromancer won't come and prove Tara right.

Name: Hunting in Dunedan
Content: You must explore Dunedan on foot, searching for traces of Hilla Shadowbringer.
ResultConclusion:
Sorka adopts the airs of an over-the-top intellectual, highlighting the dark spots on the lily cobras and flytraps that you defeated. 

Shadowbringer really is around.

Name: Wellnear Lucky Dip
Content: A Wellnear family needs clothing but cannot afford the expensive services of Carl Sifer at the Scarlet Warehouse. The warehouse offers a lucky dip for new clothes. Who will fortune smile upon this day?
Hint: This daily quest has no success limit.

Name: [d] Qute pour tester des roles
Content: test

Name: The six pillars
Content: A spherical cavity is clearly visible in each of the six pillars.
ResultConclusion: A large golem appears before you.

Name: Ralouf's ritual
Content: Such a ritual requires a lot of time and must not be interrupted by the Ratmen.
Introduction: Watch the scene while Ralouf and the druid make the incantations.
ResultConclusion: Lit only by the light of the moon, the druid recites incantations while sprinkling Ralouf with blood using the bone of a ratman. Many forest animals are grouped around the clearing and observe the scene religiously. Ralouf is carried away by a spiritual trance and dances on the spot while his spirit is traveling in the other world. After more than an hour, he comes to himself and looks at you with his usual toothless smile. You understand that the operation was a success.

Name: The Ancient Fresco
Content: The fresco is crude, like it's been drawn by a five-year-old. Still, the scene it depicts is clear: two women locked in an epic duel on either side of a baby.
Introduction: A white beam is unleashed from the purifier and hits the adjacent cliff. At the spot where it meets the cliff, you believe you can make out a faded painting.
ResultConclusion:
Thanks to your talents and persistence, you're able to find a small mechanism where the arms of the two women meet.

After pulling the lever, runes appear above the baby's head. But you're unable to decipher them.

You will have to find someone who knows the art and show them the fresco.

Name: A Tool for Bonbras
Content: Ulrick Bonbras practices hashpick throwing near the cliff in his spare time. As he inevitably loses them in the river, he would like a new one delivered. Can you help him?
Hint: This quest can be done every day. It does not influence your reputation progress.

Name: Ruins of the Wellnear Portal
Content: You are standing in front of the ancient ruins trying to find a way to activate the damaged portal. You can't help but ponder the great civilisation that must have built these wonders.

Name: The Brigands' Fate
Content: It is very likely that the brigands have mounted this fairly elaborate trap to lure inexperienced adventurers into their web. However, it remains to be seen whether they acted on their own.
ResultConclusion:
The brigands told you that they were working with Landeroy, the real leader of Kortombourg's outlaws, and that he was in the Camp of Last Chances. 

They also explain to you that several of Landeroy's men were sent to spread the news. The idea was to drop nave adventurers into the trap and rob them blind. 

You wonder if Thume Atuvu was connected to all this. You will ask him the question, but you will have to live with his answer, whether it is honest or not. 

You don't forget to pick up their purses and valuables before leaving.

Name: The Last of the Joktos
Content: When you arrive, the creature is standing, leaning on a cane made from the remains of the den.
Introduction: You go back to the dying Joktos to try to figure out what's going on.
ResultConclusion:
Palenne gives a small amulet to the Joktos to allow him to leave the cave and pass the cursed barrier.

Before leaving, the creature shows you a hidden lever in the wall of the cave.

Name: A Lost Chest
Content: You have found a lost chest.

Name: Trouble in the Hills
Content: Authorities in Larcen are asking for help to reduce the danger posed by the Zorburrs and Razburrs in the Ridand'hok hills.
Introduction: You have to hunt the creatures in the hills of Ridand'hok.

Name: An Official Pursuit
Content: Making your way through the wetland trees, you're awestruck at the places you have just found. As your amazement subsides, you're brought back to reality by the sight of Brosa desperately clinging to a tree growing in the chasm.
Introduction: You hear a loud cry coming from deeper in the forest, it's obviously Brosa.
ResultConclusion:
The rest of your trip with Brosa goes smoothly.

You are all too aware that the dramatic details of this excursion will not go unheard by the people of Gantras...

... and that means there is little chance that the fearsome reputation of the nuertogolems will be diminished.

Name: Stuck
Content: A cart is mired in the swamp. You won't be able to salvage it, but its cargo may be another matter.

Name: Ruins of the Chimeric Portal
Content: You are standing in front of the ruins, looking for a way to activate the portal.

Name: The itinerant herbalist
Content: You see a young woman who seems to be picking plants. She sees you and beckons you to come closer. She says she's looking for savouran, and she's ready to buy some from you if you bring her some.

Name: The exchange of minoris catalysts
Content: Yolasula often needs Minoris Catalyst for her experiments with explosive golems. She exchanges them for better quality catalysts.
Hint: This daily scenario is for your companions' enchantments.

Name: Strange Reflections
Content: When you reach the edge of the magnificent lake, you notice peculiar reflections in the water. There is surely something important to recover there, you must find a way to reach it.

Name: Ruins of the Thorval Portal
Content: You stand in front of the mighty ruins looking for a way to activate the portal.

Name: A Mistpiercer
Content: You have found a Mistpiercer, a machine capable of sowing chaos if misused. To destroy it, you will need to first face its guardians.

Name: Stoneworking Mastery
Content: You have agreed to help Julie with her sculptural contract representing an imaginary world in the Mists.
ResultConclusion:
You tried to represent Valsonge symbolically by sculpting its grand central Misthouse pushing back the foggy darkness.

Hopefully they won't ask you too many questions about your inspiration.

Name: The Fatal Descent
Content: A hunter is planning to canoe down the river to save time. He has apparently forgotten about the existence of the sizeable waterfall.

Name: Altamire's Corruption(bad)
Content: The spirit of the ancient dragon of Altamire has been corrupted. You must purify it with the help of the old druid Rudugul.
ResultConclusion: The ritual is complete. The cave is now purified.

Name: Learning the Basics of Wind Evocation
Content: Yolasula invites you to learn the basics of wind evocation to continue dealing with the golem issue.

Name: Panorama: Pages Mounds
Content: This seems like a suitable place for you to use your Lantern to scan the region.

Name: No Questions Asked
Content: You finally arrive at the location. You don't see anyone around.
Introduction: The mysterious crate must be dropped in a specific location on the Algent Plateau and no questions should be asked.
ResultConclusion: As you leave, you notice that the crate sinks quietly into the ground.

Name: Learning the Basics of Fire Evocation
Content: Yolasula wants to teach you the basics of fire evocation so that you can help her defeat the wood golems that she has lost in the wild.
ResultConclusion:
Amazingly quickly, you learn how to summon flames. The similarities between evocation and controlling the Mists likely have something to do with your natural aptitude. 

Yolasula asks you where you made your "Primario-Arcanus". Not knowing how to answer, you tell her that time is running out if she doesn't want to lose the golems.

Name: Test Find a site
Content: [d] I show you a point on a map and you have to go there, it's a bit of magic ... in fact, not at all
Introduction: It starts * drum roll *
ResultIntroduction: After several hours of intense research you have come to the right place.
ResultConclusion: It's all over, have a good beer

Name: Home Renovations
Content: Rhavina asked you for some furniture for her house. The difficult part will be delivering it in good condition.
ResultConclusion:
Rhavina seems very satisfied with your work.

After inspecting the contents of the box for a few minutes, she takes out some artefacts which she offers you as a reward for your services.

Name: The Contested Lands
Content: The followers of the Claw are attempting to set up exploration camps in the region. The followers of the Circle are trying to prevent them because a rare endangered plant grows in the vicinity.

Name: Saving Badouk
Content: When you arrive at the Mountainfoot Relay, Badouk is visibly relieved. He now seems more willing to tell you about his adventures.
Introduction: Accompany Badouk from the fortress to the Mountainfoot Relay.
ResultIntroduction: Badouk is now safe at the Mountainfoot Relay.

Name: Work on the Bridge
Content: The expected supon delivery is nowhere to be seen. It is unlikely that you will be able to cross the bridge in the next few days if you do not bring wood to the workers.
Introduction: You will find supon in this forest.
ResultConclusion: Ulrick thanked you for your help and informed you that he also manages another site located nearby. He hinted that he may well need your help there as well.

Name: Saharanelle Raid
Content: You are raiding the Saharanelle dungeon for the Collector. His goal is to recover three ancient objects that are there.
Introduction: The Collector has provided you with a metabrumic key that allows you to access the Saharanelle raid. You are looking for three lost items in the tower dungeon.
ResultConclusion: The collector takes the objects and places them in a strange furnace-like machine.

Name: Oryctorans
Content: As soon as you arrive, the oryctoran rises up onto its hind legs and begins scanning the horizon. You follow its gaze to the distant silhouettes of cylmos.
Introduction: You must bring the oryctoran to the mountains of Arwen and free it.
ResultConclusion: To your surprise, the creature gives a shrill cry and leaps off towards the figures. Looks like the academicians of Korllights were right this time.

Name: An End to Contamination
Content: You don't waste time finding the place where the river was poisoned. You just have to use the remedy prepared by the Kortombourgers. However, you must take all the necessary precautions so as not to be surprised by the group responsible for the poisoning.
Introduction: You have listened to Celeste's latest directives and now you are ready to go.
ResultConclusion:
After having succeeded in repairing the damage caused by the unknown enemy of Kortombe, you return to the village and report to Celeste. 

She thanks you for your help, but admits that she may still need you. She says she is surprised but happy that you were not attacked. She also confirms that she will ask Sir Verdant to investigate the origin of the toxins.

Name: A Lost Chest
Content: You have found a lost chest.

Name: Carried by the Wind
Content: You notice some objects tangled in the bushes. Surely carried there by the last storm.

Name: The Search of Pandolfo
Content: On the ground near the plinth, you discover a plaque upon which a message is written:  "Between desert and red rock, a titan serpent rests."

Name: Blue Swamp Totem
Content: We won't tell stories, you know very well that this totem will not change the conclusion of your adventure. But it's always interesting to do an investigation.
ResultIntroduction: Indeed, the fate of the world will not be linked to your study of this totem. But you found a hiding place in the mouth of one of the sculptures.

Name: Help the Norgarrs
Content: For the Norgarr to live in peace, the trogulnus must die.
Introduction: There are still trogulnus in the Chimera Forest and the Bulgrof Forest. You must kill them so the norgarrs can live in peace.
ResultConclusion: That should do. If there are others left, there aren't enough of them to harm the norgarrs.

Name: The ruined bridge
Content: A ruined structure stands before you. It is obviously a bridge that has not been crossed for ages. Even though it's crumbled and impassable, you think you can salvage some materials from this old carcass.
ResultConclusion: You manage to collect a satisfying amount of building materials without getting carried away by the current.

Name: A Difficult Delivery in Finorgan
Content: When you arrive, the camp is deserted. A sign tells you to leave the materials in the centre of the camp.
Introduction: You must deliver materials in the wooded area of Finorgan via the Argent Plateau.
ResultConclusion: There is a purse hanging under the sign, you assume it is for you.

Name: Doussoie for Carl
Content: Carl asked you to bring him some doussoie fibre that grows around the Fairy Forest. You will need an eliandel billhook to pick it.
ResultConclusion: Carl seems very happy with your delivery. He gives you what he promised.

Name: Botanical Mastery
Content: You are ready to perform the botanical ritual.

Name: The exchange of minoris emblems
Content: Maratatinus gives many small gifts at the festivals he organizes. He is interested in trading simple emblems for a higher quality one.
Hint: This daily scenario is for your companions' enchantments.

Name: A Specialized Tool for the Warehouse
Content: One of the craftsmen on the site needs a highly specialised tool for his work.
Hint: This daily quest is available as long as another quest is not completed.

Name: Plain and Simple
Content: You have finally found the Domaine Rabouf. Now you just have to give the letter to Gerald Rabouf and your mission will be finished.
Introduction: To make the job more interesting, Mylena refused to tell you exactly where her friend was. However, she explained to you that his farm was called Domaine Rabouf. She also told you what area she was in. You will have to explore those plains to find it.
ResultIntroduction: After having given the letter to Gerald Rabouf, he gives you a small purse as a thank you. You chat for a few minutes before taking your leave. The farmer suggests that you return to see Mylena Imratti in Kortombourg Square.

Name: In Search of the Unknown
Content: Arriving at the relay, you notice a bruised and exhausted man sitting at one of the tables. He matches the description of Badouk Brank's companion.
Introduction: You should take the road north to reach Mountainfoot Relay.

Name: A Herbalist's Research...
Content: The Golden Gin herbalist is in need of local plants.
Introduction: It is known that the Golden Gin is in these surroundings.

Name: Finishing Fuels
Content: The blast furnace has a constant need for wood for the creation of coal. The use of rarer essence coals allows for the better finishing of weapons.
Hint: Progress of this questline: {0}/{1}

Name: Brumedor's Past
Content: You attempt to learn more about the past of the hamlet, especially the tragic history enshrouding the former son of the chief.
Hint: Progress of this questline: {0}/{1}

Name: The Jump Strike Trick
Content: Sorka takes advantage of your break on the top of the ledge to provide you combat training. How will you act?

Name: Ruins of the Grandfall Portal
Content: You are standing in front of the ruins, looking for a way to activate the portal.

Name: The Heart of Dar'hon
Content: Lily and her troops still haven't found a heart of Dar'hon.
Introduction: You are looking for a heart of Dar'hon for Lily and the Kofo-Lun.

Name: The Secret of the Aciel
Content: A northern barbarian, or perhaps southern (his accent is almost indecipherable), invites you to compete in a traditional contest from his home: a race through the trees wherein touching the ground spells instant defeat.

Name: Toride's War
Content: You have agreed to help Toride reduce the threat from the trolls in the hope of finding a subterranean passage to the Peak of Fear.
ResultConclusion:
Toride notices that you have found a large number of aureate claws. She tells you the story of the Claw Shaman who lives in a hidden cave in Gantras.

He might be interested in these claws.

Name: Clue Collection
Content: After listening to your report on your first mission, Baroness Relene decided that it was important to give you access to the family crypt to allow you to deepen your research. Now is the time to use the skills of your team to try to solve the puzzle.
ResultIntroduction: After finding some interesting objects, you return to discuss with the baroness. She looks at Reinfort's manuscript, Annabelle's journal, and the incriminating painting. Unfortunately, she does not seem to be convinced of the authenticity of all the documents.

Name: Clues on the Nauseating Well
Content: Palenne left clues for Sally about her quest to defeat the creature named Bobu. Sally must be with you to read the missive.
ResultConclusion:
You have given Sally time to meditate and reflect on her future as a healer.

She comes back to you more determined than ever to face Bobu.

Name: The Conflict Outside the Inn
Content: You accompany Lorne Valiant who wants to confront Durong and his gang directly. Together, you approach The Dancing Cybelfly but before you reach the door, the commotion begins.
Introduction: You can feel the tension in the air as your party heads out of the Alderman's House and towards the inn.

Name: A distant corrupted memory, Volume 8
Content: The runes invoke a memory that you must face alone.

Name: Prescriptions of the Elders
Content: You must bring plants to the House of the Setting Sun which will be used to create medicines for retired adventurers.
ResultConclusion: It seems unlikely to you that these plants could actually be used for medicine.

Name: Ridiculous Snap Hooks
Content: A group of adventurers have dropped Yol's snap hooks while in the Ridiculous Mountains. You should try to find them.
ResultConclusion: Yoel takes the snap hooks while muttering a few curse words about the group of adventurers that dropped them.

Name: Autodidact of the Swamps
Content: You set out to teach yourself how to survive in the harsh forests and swamps of the province. Darkblade Marsh has all the challenges necessary to allow you to perfect your mastery of these terrains.
ResultConclusion: Something clicks and you reach new levels of confidence. Now all you have to do is practise.

Name: The Power of Babies
Content: A gremfyr mother and her cubs appear to be trapped in a hole. They are all visibly distressed and panicked. You don't have the heart to leave them to die. A baby is a baby after all.

Name: Stone Golems
Content: Defeat the golems using the water evocation you have learned.
Introduction: Yolasula told you that the stone golems headed southeast from her abode.
ResultConclusion: You have successfully defeated the stone golem! Return to Yolasula.

Name: The Terrifying Passage
Content: A crack in the cavern wall could be explored by a cave specialist.
ResultConclusion:
It was a terrifying, yet constructive expedition. The tunnel was was not only pitch black, but parts of it were fully submerged.

You didn't find anything of monetary value, but the experience taught you a lot about subterranean travel.

Name: Fantasies of the Thorax
Content: Ardent works on a very special aromatic project for a new alcohol. He asks you for very particular products for his attempts to find the ultimate taste.
Hint: This daily quest can be completed 25 times.

Name: Missing Youth
Content: Most of the inhabitants of the egrom do not have any information on the young alchemists. However, you have the strong impression that at least one person knows more. You must therefore push your investigation further.
Introduction: Go to the egrom in the Woodlands of the Prankster to find out about the missing students.
ResultConclusion:
A young believer in the egrom explains that he spoke at length with one of the students. The group, including a young woman, were looking for a golden mushroom.

Unfortunately for you, your interlocutor has no clue as to where you could find such an abnormal plant. 

Maybe someone else from the egrom can help you.

Name: The Not-so Great Axe
Content: A huge battle axe hangs on the wall. Do you want to try to take it?
ResultConclusion: This axe is rusted, cumbersome, and totally unusable! Still, the venture has given you some ideas on the best axe fighting techniques.

Name: Altamire's Corruption
Content: The spirit of the ancient dragon of Altamire has been corrupted. You must purify it with the help of the old druid Rudugul.
Introduction: The spirit of the ancient dragon of Altamire has been corrupted. You must purify it with the help of the old druid Rudugul.
ResultConclusion: The ritual is complete. The cave is now purified.

Name: Delivery for Charles
Content: You need to bring a package to Charles at the top of the Ridiculous Mountains.

Name: The pile of stone
Content: As you walk up the slope, you notice a small pile of rock.

Name: The Lost Necklace
Content: To the south, in the Silent Plain, Amanda lost her mother's necklace near the lake while being chased by a huge oryctus.

Name: An Agricultural Argument
Content: In the distance, you can hear two farmers arguing in thick country accents about the best way to plough a field.

Name: A Lost Chest
Content: You have found a lost chest. However, it is guarded by a creature. You will need to fight it first.

Name: The Idiot Peasant
Content: A young farmer does not understand that the plants should not be watered too much. Maybe you could help him.

Name: Mercenary Conflict
Content: As you arrive in the centre of Kortombourg, Sir Verdant explains that Deidra Malengueule, a mercenary, has insulted a member of the Grognards. The two groups of troops are preparing to confront each other. You should decide on the best course of action to calm the rising tensions.
Introduction: You leave towards the centre of the village accompanied by Tarul Verdant.
ResultConclusion: Tarul Verdant seems satisfied with the departure of the mercenaries from the seigneury, but he remains worried about the agitation of the citizens. After talking to him for a few minutes, he thanks you and returns to the barracks.

Name: Before You Go
Content: Sorka doesn't want to exit the cave until you have absolutely everything you need for your quests. These types of adventurers are locally known as "completionists".
ResultConclusion: You have everything. Sorka believes it's time to escape the cave and return to her camp.

Name: Fuel for Raonis
Content: The blast furnace has a constant need for wood for the creation of coal.
Hint: Progress of this questline: {0}/{1}

Name: The hanging necklace
Content: A necklace shining with a thousand lights hangs on the cliff, it will be a good challenge to climb up to the object.
ResultConclusion: Unfortunately, the necklace falls off as soon as you get close. You still get some gems of interest.

Name: Shockwave
Content: Something happened here. Fallen trees are aligned on the ground as if some great force had toppled them all at once. You can search the area for clues.

Name: A distant corrupted memory, Volume 6
Content: The runes invoke a memory that you must face alone.

Name: Dar'hon Ritual Combat
Content: Since the majority of Lily's warriors had to leave for the desert, you agreed to take on the ritual combat with Dar'hon. Lily will provide you with a piece of armor in exchange for your participation.
Hint: This scenario can be done once a week.

Name: A Delicate Situation
Content: It seems clear that Scissana is aware of the world outside of the Mist. As for your side, you have no idea how the local authorities of Valsonge would react if they knew what had happened to you. You must find a way to convince the new steward to help you.

Name: The "Wild" Guilds
Content: While Arisha takes care of the other, you have agreed to take care of one of the guilds seeking to perform in the Park of the Golden Word.

Name: The Great Road
Content: After arriving at your destination, a lady with a stern look approaches you.
Introduction: You must accompany Bilina to Thorval.
ResultConclusion: Some checks are made with the employees of the harbourmaster's office. As everything seems to be in order, you leave the girl in the capable hands of her aunt.

Name: Purification of Nopeak
Content: Upon arriving at the delivery location, you see no trace of the guild team.
Introduction: The team responsible for the cleansing of the ruins of Nopeak requires a shipment of materials for their ritual.
ResultConclusion:
After performing a short ritual for the purifier, you wait a while to see what happens.

Nothing.

Nothing... is that a sign that it worked? You're not sure.

When all of a sudden...

Name: A Sculpture Most Macabre
Content:
A disturbing sculpture made entirely of bones slotted inside one another has been constructed on top of a rock. 

There is a good chance it's cursed, so you should dismantle it. Frankly, you should dismantle it even if it isn't.

Name: The Taming of the Blob
Content: It's evident from the peculiar substance's movements that it is in fact a living creature endowed with some form of intelligence. With a little practice, you might be able to control it.
Hint: This creature can reach level 20 and requires a solidity 10 cage.

Name: The Price of Passage to the Druids
Content: You must convince the residents of the Hamlet of Brumedor to ferry you to Laematsu Island.

Name: The Mist Detector
Content: Following Leonidas's instructions, you try to perceive variations in the veil of the Mists in order to discover a vortex or rift.

Name: The Lotus in Gantras
Content: You received word in Gantras that an organisation known as the Order of the Lotus has a growing presence there. You think it's a secret best shared.

Name: "Who is right?"
Content: Two miners are in conflict over the provenance of the precious stones they have found. Could you resolve their dispute?

Name: The Enigma of a Thousand Eyes
Content:
You arrive in front of an ancient stone. Engraved upon it is an unsolved enigma left by civilisations long passed. 

You will need an extraordinary sense of observation to find the solution to the puzzle.

Name: The Source of the Gremfyrs
Content:
Myrtille explained to you that it's possible the gremfyr are controlled by a magical creature living near an underground spring.

To start your investigation, visit the cave through the forest to the east.
Introduction: The cave through the forest to the east is a good place to start your investigation.

Name: The Sinking Ruins
